Job_Descriptions: ZALORA is on a mission to become the leading Fashion & Lifestyle destination for our customers within South-East Asia and we’re looking for somebody who understands what it takes to build delightful customer experiences in hard-to-copy and margin-enhancing ways to help us with that! At ZALORA, we understand that the world of payments is complex, and payment transactions can be a source of stress for our customers when they are completing their orders. Friction during the payment process is a key contributor to drop-offs in the purchase funnel. We aim to make the payments experience secure and friction-free by offering localized, safe and recognized payment options to our customers. We are looking for a Product Manager who brings a good understanding of how money moves between customers, merchants, payment partners and everyone else in between. You’ll help enable new payment capabilities for our customers, while delivering experiences that lead to customer delight and help drive conversions. You’ll be working with external payment partners, internal business stakeholders and engineering teams across SEA to manage and deliver a portfolio of strategic initiatives within the payments vertical. Here are our expectations for this role: You have prior experience in enabling new payment methods or partner integrations within the greater payments ecosystem consisting of payment gateways, PSPs, payment networks, merchant service providers, issuers, and acquirers. You’re able to lead the product strategy for your product area across all platforms and geographies–taking into account the ZALORA strategy and determining how you and your team's efforts can contribute towards it. Product Strategy for us is about team mission, goals, measures of success, and priorities You can own the entire product life-cycle from identifying an opportunity to ideation to prioritization and delivery - you can think strategically about the direction we’re heading, but also dive into the details of specifics within your product remit to ensure nothing is missed and requirements are covered. You can, along with your team, deliver great products to a high-quality and at pace through effective delivery management. We’re not a bunch of project managers, but delivering is key to realizing value and we put a lot of focus on ensuring we can deliver Able to take in qualitative and quantitative insights, and generate inferences and hypotheses to inform your strategy and/or direction, or to drive future experiments Keen and able to collaborate closely with and lead a cross-functional team where you’ll be working with Junior Product Managers, Designers, and Engineers from ideation through to launch whilst creating a sense of co-authorship and shared responsibility. Have a keen eye for slicing work into its smallest valuable increments to deliver value fast, and to constantly be looking to improve our user experience and not leave it to gather dust. We’re looking for someone that cares about building delightful experiences over time. Can build trusting and collaborative partnerships with colleagues from across the organization, ideating together, and taking on board their feedback, pairing that with customer insight and making decisions, and articulating next steps that’ll be in the best interest of ZALORA and our customers. Understand customer value, how it’s delivered, and can be an evangelist within the business for focusing on the customer. It might not happen every day, but you’re diligent in us getting towards that state Some additional requirements: We are looking for experienced Product Managers with rich and varied experience solving big consumer problems ideally within South-East Asia. Need to be highly effective in a distributed team environment where most of our work is done digitally over video calls, digital whiteboards, and other collaborative software. Your team members are spread across the Asia region What we offer: Become a part of an ambitious and collaborative product & engineering team where you’ll be building products for millions of consumers across SEA. Be a part of one of the most international and diverse teams in Asia. A versatile role with a healthy dose of responsibility and empowerment to do your best work and bring maximum impact. Exciting opportunities for career progression, within a company that is known for long-tenure, in either the individual contributor or management pathways as our organization continues to scale and grow. This position can be located in either Singapore, Malaysia, Indonesia, the Philippines, or Vietnam. We will support relocation if required, however, we don’t expect anyone to relocate until it’s safe to do so. If this sounds like the next big adventure you want to take on in your career then please send us your CV + a cover letter (max. 200 words) on why this role excites you! The ZALORA Story ZALORA is Asia’s leading online fashion, beauty and lifestyle destination, part of Global Fashion Group. As one of the region’s pioneer large-scale ecommerce platforms, ZALORA has established a strong presence throughout the region, particularly in Singapore, Indonesia, Malaysia, Brunei, the Philippines, Hong Kong, and in Taiwan, enjoying over 50 million visits per month. ZALORA is not obligated to accept resumes from any third parties on behalf of potential candidates for any position (advertised or otherwise) by any means, unless ZALORA has executed a written agreement with such third party and has expressly requested such third party for candidate referrals. Third parties who provide unsolicited resumes of candidate(s) shall waive and forfeit all rights to claim for any placement fees or referral fees in the event that such candidate is eventually engaged or employed by ZALORA or Global Fashion Group.

Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience. 6 years of working experience in a customer support role or role related to troubleshooting technical issues. Experience with HTML, SQL, and Javascript. Preferred qualifications: Experience supporting YouTube Ads products. Knowledge of YouTube Ads (Auction and/or Reserve). Knowledge of ad products and third-party ad-serving, and/or demonstrated ability to become an expert in new ad products in short time frame. Ability to remain calm while managing crisis issues and communications. Excellent stakeholder management skills. About the job gTech Global Customer Care (gGCC) is a solution-generating effort that helps our sales teams and advertisers. These solutions need to be scalable to support millions of customers worldwide. In addition to troubleshooting on the customer side, we work with Sales, Product, and Engineering teams within Google to develop better tools and services and improve our products based on the evolving needs of our users. As a cross-functional and global team, it's our job to help keep the lights on and the ads fresh. In this role, you'll expedite resolution across various points and teams, and provide seamless experience for customer's entire interaction with support. You'll also minimize preventable product bugs and customer escalations through proactive and retrospective analysis. You'll improve expertise coverage across Technical Product Escalations (TPEs) to improve quality of service. You'll make the product better for internal and external customers while cultivating a closer partnership between global gTech teams. You'll establish partnerships with stakeholders to improve the customer experience. The Technical Product Escalations (TPE) team covers a suite of ad products across brand, performance, and platforms ad products. Google creates products and services that make the world a better place, and gTech’s role is to help bring them to life. Our teams of trusted advisors support customers globally. Our solutions are rooted in our technical skill, product expertise, and a thorough understanding of our customers’ complex needs. Whether the answer is a bespoke solution to solve a unique problem, or a new tool that can scale across Google, everything we do aims to ensure our customers benefit from the full potential of Google products. To learn more about gTech, check out our video. Resposibilities Own product bug escalation, triage, and prioritization. Manage communications for critical product issues impacting regional services and business teams. Coalesce and collect product feedback and insights to ensure that serviceability needs/features are represented and qualified for gTech to prioritize with Product Managers and Engineering. Collaborate with YouTube Speciality support through knowledge management. Participate in after-hours on-call rotation.

Job_Title: Market Responsibility Specialist, Trust and Safety, YouTube (Tagalog)
Job_Descriptions: Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience in tech policy, intelligence or regulations/ government relations. 5 years of experience in cross-functional project management across senior stakeholders. Experience with the local politics, media landscape, culture, and context of the Filipino market. Ability to speak, read/write in English and Tagalog fluently to identify abuse trends. Preferred qualifications: Experience working with Product Management and Engineers to drive progress on key programs. Effective analytical skills and the ability to use data to drive strategy and business action, experience with SQL and spreadsheet softwares preferred. Ability to build effective relationships with cross-functional partners across geographies. Excellent organizational, interpersonal, and project management skills with excellent attention to detail. About the job Fast-paced, dynamic, and proactive, YouTube’s Trust & Safety team is dedicated to making YouTube a safe place for users, viewers, and content creators around the world to belong, create, and express themselves. Whether understanding and solving their online content concerns, navigating within global legal frameworks, or writing and enforcing worldwide policy, the Trust & Safety team is on the frontlines of enhancing the YouTube experience, building internet safety, and protecting free speech in our ever-evolving digital world. As a Market Responsibility Specialist supporting the local market, you will be responsible for ensuring that we are constantly growing our understanding of regional and local trends and risks on YouTube. You will proactively monitor trends and intelligence sources, help to launch new product features with market and language knowledge, and ensure our enforcement guidelines are informed by your market knowledge. You'll help implement and enforce our policies across content videos, as well as define and implement operational plans globally, liaising and working with stakeholders in areas such as Product Management, Engineering, Vendor Operations, Analytics, Public Policy, PR, Partnerships, and Legal. In this role, you may review graphic, controversial, and sometimes offensive video content during team escalations in line with YouTube’s Community Guidelines. At YouTube, we believe that everyone deserves to have a voice, and that the world is a better place when we listen, share, and build community through our stories. We work together to give everyone the power to share their story, explore what they love, and connect with one another in the process. Working at the intersection of cutting-edge technology and boundless creativity, we move at the speed of culture with a shared goal to show people the world. We explore new ideas, solve real problems, and have fun — and we do it all together. Resposibilities Monitor intel sources, work with cross-functional teams, and leverage deep market expertise to identify key abuse trends in the Filipino market, monitor emerging sensitive events, and highlight risks to the YouTube ecosystem and Trust and Safety. Speak Tagalog and English fluently in order to effectively identify and propose policy improvements based on market nuances, and support language detection, automation, language quality improvements, and local product launches. Support identification and vetting of external partners. Triage threats, prepare risk assessments, and action plans based on market knowledge, including regional events and escalations, and act as the main point of contact. Drive and support the launch of news related product features in the region.

We are looking to bring onboard highly committed individual to develop cargo-partner’s industry vertical in technology. If you are passionate about work, customer oriented, self-driven and someone who is up for challenge, then you are THE ONE for us! Identify, manage, maintain and maximise growth potential of strategic Key Accounts in responsible countries Develop a growth strategy focused on both financial gain and customer satisfaction Actively lead business negotiations with customers on behalf of the company Serve as a strategic business partner with customers using technology expertise and account manager capabilities to support portfolio  of products Work in close collaboration with country Sales and products teams from overseas offices to deliver superior services Lead regional implementation of new accounts and services Keep abreast with market trends and landscape changes Bachelors Degree, preferably in Logistics and Supply Chain Minimum 5 years of freight forwarding background with technology expertise Possess established customer contacts in the industry along with solid network of technology companies Solid knowledge of regulatory requirements of the technology industry. Self-driven, good attitude, integrity and resourceful Highly competent in planning, organizing, executing and coordination skills Customer focused and results oriented Strong analytical and problem solving skills High influencing and negotiation skills Skillful in strategic presentations to steer acceptance and decision making Able to work across geographical and functional boundaries and in a cultural diverse environment Willingness and ability to travel Company Introduction: cargo-partner is a privately owned full-range info-logistics provider offering a comprehensive portfolio of air, sea, land transport and warehousing services, with special expertise in information technology and supply chain optimization. The company operates over 140 offices in over 40 countries around the world to create fast and efficient solutions for a wide range of industries. With the SPOT platform, cargo-partner ensures easy cooperation and full transparency throughout the supply chain. As a family-owned business, we are very employee-oriented and want to work with you to develop your career and personal goals. Take a look at our Mission & Vision. If you are looking for a challenging position in an innovative and dynamic international company, we want to get to know you! Apply now! It will only take a minute, we promise!

Who we are Beca is one of Asia Pacific’s largest independent advisory, design and engineering consultancies. After a century of operation, we have grown from a family-owned business to one of the most progressive, client-centric professional services consultancies in our region. We have more than 3,300 employees in 21 offices around the world and have delivered projects in more than 70 countries. About Beca ‘Creative people together transforming our world’ is our vision. It reflects our culture, our aspirations and our purpose - to make every day better. We create value through understanding and delivering successful solutions, exceptional service and our enduring relationships and use our skills and systems to empower innovation; helping our clients shape communities, optimise their assets and streamline their operations. Our employee-ownership model remains key to our future. It underpins our commitment to building and sustaining long-term relationships with our clients, it helps drive our positive, purpose-driven and growth-oriented culture, it sets us apart from our competitors, and it gives meaning to our social contract. While our experience has been 100 years in the making, it is the fresh talent we're nurturing, the innovative thinking we're developing and the connections that we're forging that get us most excited for the future. We are currently recruiting for Engineer – Electrical to join our Building Services team. This position will be based in our Singapore Office. Engineer - Electrical JOB DESCRIPTION Under the supervision of Senior Engineers, to perform initial engineering task on the electrical services detailed design (including calculations, computer simulations, etc.) for building projects To prepare submission to authorities for approval of design To attend to project meeting with Client, PM and Consultants from other disciplines To attend site project meeting and site inspection, and reply to technical queries KEY REQUIREMENT Degree in Electrical Engineering discipline 1 to 3 years working experiences in consultancy industry will be an advantage Able to work independently and exercise initiatives Excellent in both written and verbal communication skills A team player; Able to interact and work with colleagues and member of other consultants at various level Schedule driven and self-motivated If this sounds like the opportunity you have been waiting for, apply now with your CV and cover letter. Please include the following information in your resume: Education background Internship/working experiences Reason(s) for leaving (if any) Expected salary Date of availability The Beca Group of Companies is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all applications are kept strictly confidential.

To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts. Job Category Business Value Services Group Job Details About Slack, a Salesforce Company Slack is more than just a tech company, we are on a mission to make your working life simpler, more pleasant and more productive. We believe that culture is the compass to success and so our Slack Values are woven into the fabric of all we do. We seek exceptional talent that is eager to do the best work of their life while supporting others in doing the same. What we're looking for: Slack is looking for a creative and passionate individual who can help define strategy, conduct business value analysis, and deliver presentations identifying and articulating the value of Slack to our top strategic customers. You will primarily work closely with our ASEAN Sales, Success, Solutions Engineering, and Product Marketing teams on our most strategic customer accounts. You will form our business value proposition, including strategic account planning, business case justification, and C-Level presentations. You will develop and present compelling value propositions, proposals, and business cases, and work with the customer success team to track value realisation in support of Slack’s largest, most strategic customers. What you will be doing: Work closely with prospective customers, Sales, and Solution Engineering to identify, prioritise, and quantify key business drivers and understand how our solutions will help customers meet their strategic objectives. Conduct and facilitate internal and external research and discovery around customer business processes, market trends, and business value analysis. Leading customers through their digital transformation journey and providing recommendations on key strategies. Enable our sales team to facilitate value-oriented discovery and deliver high-level business value/impact analysis. Identify target operational and financial metrics impacted by the potential Slack solution and then use these metrics to develop models to quantify the strategic value of Slack. Craft and deliver executive-level presentations to CxOs. Create qualitative and quantitative analysis in support of targeted opportunities. Assist with developing value messaging associated with targeted opportunities. Validate messaging is aligned with customer value themes. Craft reusable assets to help scale the team's reach across the greater Slack organisation. Provide tactical support for targeted opportunities. Manage a library of assets, including items such as spreadsheets, presentation templates, case examples, and customer stories. What you should have: University degree in a quantitative field (e.g. Business, finance, economics, math, engineering, marketing, or related areas). Demonstrated relevant experience, ideally in Finance, Strategy Consulting, or other analytical roles in a professional services environment. Experience leading through digital transformation initiatives. Experience creating and delivering compelling presentations and business case artifacts (internally or externally facing). Executive presence aptitude or experience. Experience facilitating workshops, and driving to tangible outcomes through design-led workshops. A self-starter who takes initiative, is creative, has high energy, and would thrive in a very dynamic software company. Excellent quantitative analysis and financial modeling skills. Experience in a sales environment would be a plus. An interest in the technology/software/SaaS space. Slack is a layer of the business technology stack that brings together people, data, and applications – a single place where people can effectively work together, find important information, and access hundreds of thousands of critical applications and services to do their best work. From global Fortune 100 companies to corner markets, businesses and teams of all kinds use Slack to bring the right people together with all the right information. Slack is headquartered in San Francisco, CA and has ten offices around the world. For more information on how Slack makes teams better connected, visit slack.com. Ensuring a diverse and inclusive workplace where we learn from each other is core to Slack’s values. We welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives. We are an equal opportunity employer and a pleasant and supportive place to work. Come do the best work of your life here at Slack! Job_Title: Principal Research Engineer, Centre for Computational Law
Job_Descriptions: Contract Middle Management Bachelor Degree | Masters | PhD Singapore | Closing On 25 Mar 2022 2-year contract About Us Singapore Management University is a place where high-level professionalism blends together with a healthy informality. The 'family-like' atmosphere among the SMU community fosters a culture where employees work, plan, organise and play together – building a strong collegiality and morale within the university. Our commitment to attract and retain talent is ongoing. We offer attractive benefits and welfare, competitive compensation packages, and generous professional development opportunities – all to meet the work-life needs of our staff. No wonder, then, that SMU continues to be given numerous awards and recognition for its human resource excellence. Job Description Work done will be at the direction of the PI, and where relevant, the Industry Director and Centre Director.As the Programme is interdisciplinary and multidisciplinary by nature, you will be expected to convey yourdomain expertise and edify others (and vice versa) in as productive, constructive, and collaborative a manneras possible. You may be asked to participate in the development of use cases and delivery of proof-of-concept prototypesfor government and industry partners in the areas of computable contracts and "rules as code". Experience inrequirements analysis and agile, iterative methodologies will be useful at this stage.The work of the team will be largely determined by these use cases and customers. We will work with multipleuse cases so that we can abstract across them and develop generalized, reusable infrastructure. We will workwith specific customers so we can build useful applications on top of that infrastructure.You will contribute to the design and development of open-source software written to serve those use cases.You will work as part of a team of research engineers, developers, and domain expertise and you will beexpected to actively participate in team meetings and text-based communications. You will be expected to beactive members of the applied research community, by validating and contributing to advances incomputational law. You may be asked to conduct use-inspired research at the direction of the Principal Investigator. This includes reading academic papers, standards publications, and related material such as blog posts and presentations coming up to speed in fields which may be new to you, such as computational linguistics, mathematical logic, programming language design, formal verification, and model-based architecture reading (and updating/commenting, relevant) existing software documentation creating presentations, video recordings, walkthroughs, etc. to document and explain research work done writing (and presenting, if so decided by the PI) academic papers and materials for publication documenting in a sufficiently-detailed manner so as to share what you've learned You will be expected to participate in software development; this includes learning how to use third party tools, including editors, IDEs, databases, business process modeling software, programming languages, and libraries evaluating competing software systems for suitability building infrastructure to enable application development managing yourself, and managing fellow team members engaging in product, project, and program management as needed reading books and consuming such other media forms about software development writing documentation such as user/developer-facing manuals, tutorials delivering community support to users and customers preparing presentations to represent the project before external audiences writing actual user-facing applications throughout the "full stack" in each case, documenting, reporting, and/or presenting the same in clearly and efficiently, both internally and externally. Qualifications Researchers under the Programme should possess both mastery of their academic speciality, anddemonstrated practical experience producing and supporting high-quality open-source code throughcommunity engagement across multiple media. Candidates must have Bachelor's, Master's, Ph.D., oralternative qualifications in computer science, software engineering, (symbolic) artificial intelligence,computational linguistics, or formal methods. Fluency in multiple natural languages, and any experience with law, are a plus. Job_Title: Manager, Client Development & Sales - Platform Solutions (APAC)
Job_Descriptions: Description The Manager Platform Solutions is responsible for the sale, distribution and ongoing usage growth of CME Group’s front-end trading applications across all Client Development and Sales (CD&S) customer segments. The Manager role requires a working understanding of real time trading applications and how they are used by a at least one customer types. Sales responsibility will encompass a subset of the CME Group Electronic Trading Applications, as well as any other CME and third-party functionality, content and market data delivered through the Electronic Trading applications, including CME Direct, QuikStrike, CME Direct Mobile, CME One, Commodity Direct, among others. To achieve their goals the Manager sales will work closely with CD&S relationship managers ensuring seamless coordination and an optimal customer experience, and to a lesser degree with relevant stakeholders across product and account management teams. As part of CD&S the Manager Platform Solutions will follow all CD&S processes including but not limited to salesforce reporting, pipeline management, account management, campaign management, country plan management and other initiatives. The Manager will ensure they continuously develop their product and service acumen in CME group platforms and related technologies specifically, but also across all asset classes and CME products. The individual will understand and stay informed of platform and ISV related issues, technologies and trends within the wider industry. Principal Accountabilities: Introducing CME Group Electronic trading platforms to existing and prospective users, demonstrating features and benefits to drive adoption, ongoing usage and supporting trading volume growth. Educating and training end-users on the functionality, benefits and opportunities that CME Group electronic trading platforms provide to traders, risk managers, and other relevant users so that they can optimize their utilization of the platforms. Ensure an optimal customer experience, facilitate ongoing usage and drive growth of trading volumes, increase usage of related functionality, and facilitate sales of market data delivered through the platforms. Support firms as well as individual users through sign-up, onboarding, upgrades and migrations of the platforms. Ensuring compliance with all relevant CME Group and third-party technology and data distribution policies and licensing delivered through the platforms. Participation in events and trade shows, showcasing CME Group platform solutions The Manager will be aligned with CD&R goals and targets, as well as actively cross-selling and cross-referring CME products and services, identifying and referring opportunities for product adoption and growth to the appropriate CD&S sales team. Skills and Software Requirements: A good understanding of wholesale financial market trading and trading platform usage is preferred at a minimum in one asset class and/or customer segment. A proven ability to work with clients including building and maintaining relationships with the financial institutions to facilitate their understanding of the application of CME Group’s products and offerings to inform their trading, investment and risk management needs. Ability to prioritize, manage, and execute responsibilities to meet or exceed objectives. Strong teamwork skills, with a demonstrated ability to interact effectively across organizations. Works towards cultivation of a culture that encourages open communication, cooperation and the sharing of information. In addition to English, fluency in at least one Asian language. Bachelor’s Degree (or equivalent) or equivalent through experience. CME Group: Where Futures Are Made CME Group (www.cmegroup.com) is the world's leading and most diverse derivatives marketplace. But who we are goes deeper than that. Here, you can impact markets worldwide. Transform industries. And build a career shaping tomorrow. We invest in your success and you own it, all while working alongside a team of leading experts who inspire you in ways big and small. Joining our company gives you the opportunity to make a difference in global financial markets every day, whether you work on our industry-leading technology and risk management services, our benchmark products or in a corporate services area that helps us serve our customers better. With 2,500 employees located around the world, we're small enough for you and your contributions to be known. But big enough for your ideas to make an impact. The pace is dynamic, the work is unlike any other firm in the business, and the possibilities are endless. Problem solvers, difference makers, trailblazers. Those are our people. And we're looking for more.

Job_Title: Treasury and Trade Solutions Financial Institutions Sector Sales (Senior Vice President)
Job_Descriptions: Position Summary and Objective: The Solution Sales Sr Specialist is a strategic professional who closely follows latest trends in own field and adapts them for application within own job and the business. The FI Sales team assists both local and multinational clients with the most complex requirements across Asia Pacific, as well as onboarding prospect clients. The role is responsible for origination and direct management of local and regional deals, managing a diverse set of clients across the FI segment where the buying or booking centre is based in Singapore. The key objectives include: 1) Increasing penetration of Citi’s FI clients within the existing client base 2) Prospecting and acquiring new clients with focus on Fintechs 3) Achieving KPI’s including pipeline, wins, revenue realization and call goals by portfolio Responsibilities: Execute sales strategy for the country in conjunction with regional and country partners Portfolio Management and Optimization: Develop deep relationships with key global and regional clients. Retain clients and grow volumes/values Identify cross sell opportunities with clients Market Presence: Be an ambassador and evangelist for Citi in the region with clients, partners, and industry forums to continue to drive Citi’s recognition as the largest and best in class Maintain leading edge expertise of the industry and regional competitive environment. Ownership and Leadership: Act as a steward of the business and influence its strategy and market leadership as a key business member of the regional and global sales team Lead complex cash management deals end-to-end including RFP responses and client pitches, recommending innovative cash management solutions. Market Development: Develop a Client focus strategy for all key clients and sub sector targets Control and Compliance: Maintain a pristine control environment for all issues related to business management, compliance, regulatory requirements such as KYC, documentation, and training Review account plans to identify sales opportunities and support origination of cash management opportunities through development of thought leadership material Develop target list of underpenetrated names to actively focus on with a “Hunting License” for growing new cash business though unsolicited bids. Meet all Sales Management goals tied to pipeline management (CRM), Deal Review and Implementation Project Kick-Offs Lead and prepare client presentations Work with Implementations/account managers to ensure deals closed our implemented effectively and efficiently to ensure revenue realization and ramp-up Actively share with Product Management Team new developments within the market updates and the environment – Attend regular team and sales management meetings to report on performance Manage key Balance Sheet Drivers including assets and liabilities Manage and partner with Banking, as appropriate, on all relevant aspects of Client Credit Risk (including credit appetite/credit commitment/returns) Work in close partnership with control functions such as Legal, Compliance, Market and Credit Risk, Audit, Finance in order to ensure appropriate governance and control infrastructure Build a culture of responsible finance, good governance and supervision, expense discipline and ethics Appropriately assess risk/reward of transactions when making business decisions; demonstrating proper consideration for the firm’s reputation. Be familiar with and adhere to Citi’s Code of Conduct and the Plan of Supervision for Global Markets and Securities Services Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency. Qualifications: 7-10 years’ experience covering large financial institution or equivalent clients with proven track record. Broad client management experience Familiarity with market dynamics and eco-systems. Excellent communication and written skills Demonstrated organizational skills (including self-organizational skills) Superior client management & deal negotiation skills Ability to interact at all levels of global, regional and local. Superior interpretive and problem solving skills Excellent team working and outstanding interpersonal skills Ability to operate in a complex matrix environment Education: Bachelor’s/University degree, Master’s degree preferred This job description provides a high-level review of the types of work performed. Job Description JOB BRIEF We are seeking a proven sales performer to help us grow and expand our footprint in Singapore. This is a role for someone who is a hunter and hungry for new business success. Responsibilities include generating new business in new accounts and expanding the footprint inside existing customers, as well as playing a key role as you drive strategic business expansion initiatives for our customers. To succeed in this role, you are strong in people-skills as well as have demonstrated past (B2B) technology sales experience preferably in F&B sector. The goal is to obtain better brand recognition and drive sustainable financial growth through boosting sales and forging strong relationships with clients within the F&B Industry in Singapore. RESPONSIBILITIES • Developing and managing relationships within the F&B sector in Singapore. • Forecast sales activity and revenue achievement while creating satisfied and reference-able customers. • Maintaining a strong understanding of products and services and innovating new ways to serve businesses. • Demonstrating our product effectively to new clients and being a champion to existing clients. Requirements • Bachelor’s degree in business, communications, marketing or related field or relevant industry experience. • Minimum 5 years of experience carrying quota and closing deals in software (business applications) or technology sales (F&B sector is a bonus) • Proficiency in English and Mandarin • Ability to flourish with minimal guidance, be proactive, and handle uncertainty. Strong organizational talents and ability to work under pressure and in new environments. • Familiarity with project management methodologies. • Ability and willingness to travel for meetings with prospective and existing clients. Desired Skills • Strong and demonstrated written and verbal communications skills. • Previous Sales Methodology training preferred. • Ability to work in a fast pace, team environment. • Strong customer references. • Strong computer skills, including CRM, Microsoft Word, PowerPoint and Excel. Job Description The researcher with partake (and should be able to take initiative) in all stages required for the development and publishing of the PERFLEXO operators, including literature review, algorithmic design, implementation, and testing under the guidance of the PI (Prof. Kyriakos Mouratidis). Qualifications Minimum a PhD degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Information Systems or a closely related discipline A solid track record, with publications in the main database conferences and journals Experience with spatial databases, multi-dimensional indices and/or computational geometry will be much preferred although not absolutely required Proficiency in programming languages such as C and C++ is required Demonstrated experience and know-how on algorithms, data structures, indexing and their implementation Good analytical, technical and problem-solving skills Applicants with research publications in the database area will be advantageous Self-motivated individual who can work independently and also collaboratively with team members

Job Description The research engineer will conduct laboratory experiences in support of a programme that aims to develop structural alloys with improved corrosion resistance. The work will involve the fabrication of novel alloys as well as electrochemical corrosion testing, along with analysis of the corrosion products (Raman, XRD, XPS and SEM). The successful candidate will also be expected to perform some adhoc addition admin duties related to safety and purchasing. Qualifications Good honours degree in Materials Science & Engineering or related discipline. Basic knowledge of corrosion mechanisms or electrochemistry is also required. Covid-19 Message At NUS, the health and safety of our staff and students are one of our utmost priorities, and COVID-vaccination supports our commitment to ensure the safety of our community and to make NUS as safe and welcoming as possible. Many of our roles require a significant amount of physical interactions with students/staff/public members. Even for job roles that may be performed remotely, there will be instances where on-campus presences are required. In accordance with Singapore's legal requirements, unvaccinated workers will not be able to work on the NUS premises with effect from 15 January 2022. As such, job applicants will need to be fully COVID-19 vaccinated to secure successful employment with NUS. Job_Title: Research Engineer, Centre for Computational Law
Job_Descriptions: Contract Manager Bachelor Degree | Masters | PhD Singapore | Closing On 25 Mar 2022 2-year contract About Us Singapore Management University is a place where high-level professionalism blends together with a healthy informality. The 'family-like' atmosphere among the SMU community fosters a culture where employees work, plan, organise and play together – building a strong collegiality and morale within the university. Our commitment to attract and retain talent is ongoing. We offer attractive benefits and welfare, competitive compensation packages, and generous professional development opportunities – all to meet the work-life needs of our staff. No wonder, then, that SMU continues to be given numerous awards and recognition for its human resource excellence. Job Description Work done will be at the direction of the PI, and where relevant, the Industry Director and Centre Director. As the Programme is interdisciplinary and multidisciplinary by nature, you will be expected to convey your domain expertise and edify others (and vice versa) in as productive, constructive, and collaborative a manner as possible. You may be asked to participate in the development of use cases and delivery of proof-of-concept prototypes for government and industry partners in the areas of computable contracts and "rules as code". Experience in requirements analysis and agile, iterative methodologies will be useful at this stage.The work of the team will be largely determined by these use cases and customers. We will work with multiple use cases so that we can abstract across them and develop generalized, reusable infrastructure. We will work with specific customers so we can build useful applications on top of that infrastructure.You will contribute to the design and development of open-source software written to serve those use cases.You will work as part of a team of research engineers, developers, and domain expertise and you will be expected to actively participate in team meetings and text-based communications. You will be expected to be active members of the applied research community, by validating and contributing to advances in computational law. You may be asked to conduct use-inspired research at the direction of the Principal Investigator. This includes reading academic papers, standards publications, and related material such as blog posts and presentations coming up to speed in fields which may be new to you, such as computational linguistics, mathematical logic, programming language design, formal verification, and model-based architecture reading (and updating/commenting, relevant) existing software documentation creating presentations, video recordings, walkthroughs, etc. to document and explain research work done writing (and presenting, if so decided by the PI) academic papers and materials for publication documenting in a sufficiently-detailed manner so as to share what you've learned You will be expected to participate in software development; this includes learning how to use third party tools, including editors, IDEs, databases, business process modeling software, programming languages, and libraries evaluating competing software systems for suitability building infrastructure to enable application development managing yourself, and managing fellow team members engaging in product, project, and program management as needed reading books and consuming such other media forms about software development writing documentation such as user/developer-facing manuals, tutorials delivering community support to users and customers preparing presentations to represent the project before external audiences writing actual user-facing applications throughout the "full stack" in each case, documenting, reporting, and/or presenting the same in clearly and efficiently, both internally and externally. Qualifications Researchers under the Programme should possess both mastery of their academic speciality, and demonstrated practical experience producing and supporting high-quality open-source code through community engagement across multiple media. Candidates must have Bachelor's, Master's, Ph.D., or alternative qualifications in computer science, software engineering, (symbolic) artificial intelligence,computational linguistics, or formal methods. Fluency in multiple natural languages, and any experience with law, are a plus. Mechanical objects, Structure and Design Requirements to ensure the Cell can meet Form, Fit & Function - devise and convert design requirements to resolution to ensure a smooth transition to production Responsibility of the mechanical integrity of cell components ensuring the design, tolerance system and assembly sequence delivers high yield, low cost solutions. Create, optimise & validate mechanical designs using appropriate modelling, simulation and analysis tools. This would include FE, impact analysis and vibration assessments. Implement lab-based testing for component or system characterisation and verification, be ready to create, implement and educate test methods for the validation team. Use systems engineering methodologies to optimise product performance and solve complex engineering problems Design mechanical solutions to meet requirements of safety, reliability and robustness for the end application. Work in tandem with the Application Engineering to realise Engineering samples and customer deliveries. Play an active role in developing new equipment methodologies and novel packaging design. Use mechanical methods to design and critique with leading vendors to enable high volume, low cost manufacturing. Generate Mechanical design information for Energy Storage, including escalating any significant recommendations or incidents, and advise the team on risk and mitigations. Build and manage relationships with internal departments, external suppliers and industry bodies within Energy Storage. Provide clear presentation of technical information and supporting documentation to ensure accurate information for other teams within the UK or the Far East. Challenge and develop engineering practices to continuously enhance efficiency. Excellent relationship-building skills with the ability to cross languages and cultures within the team. Ability to work sensitively, discreetly, and effectively across the company. 3+ years' experience of Mechanical/Design Engineering technical matters. Experience working with hardware development and production A good understanding of the fundamentals of the design process and an awareness of the application of Cells, Modules and Pack systems. A broad understanding of material properties and manufacturing processes related to Cell engineering materials. Experience in laboratory-based testing and validation of materials and sub-systems. Appreciation of the fundamentals of software tools for development - LabVIEW/ Python. Experience of working within a Battery-powered program a strong advantage. Delivery team experience. Strong organizational skills with a methodical and detailed approach. Persistent approach to problem-solving and an inquisitive nature Must demonstrate a passion for working

: SINGAPORE-SINGAPORE-SINGAPORE :  AXA Singapore : Regular : Day Job : Full-time We are seeking an experienced Manager to lead our Protection & Health (“P&H”) Team to develop business cases for approvals and implement various initiatives to drive Protection and Health sales. You will work with the channel Heads and their sales teams, Product and Actuarial teams for development of business cases, Marketing, Digital, Training Teams for implementation and local product management committee (“LPMC”) members. You will also manage external stakeholders including advisers of various levels from different sales channels and gift vendors. Responsibilities include but not limted to: Drive customer campaigns and redemption process, putting emphasis on P&H policies Manage AXA Protector Club for Agency, including recognition criteria, periodic challenges and rewards to drive P&H. Collaborate with various departments to implement marketing activity to promote P&H and proposition training to advisers to build their competence in selling P&H Engage with key distributors to review and develop actions to improve their P&H sales Provide career development support to team members At least 8 years of relevant experience in distributor engagement, customer campaigns, product proposition training and marketing Knowledge and experience in Singapore life insurance industry and regulations is preferred Proven track record in leading, coaching and training a team Posses excellent communication and influencing skills, which are vital to getting buy-in from different stakeholders Ability to work independently and drive end-to-end launch of all initiatives and meet tight deadlines AXA Insurance is part of the AXA group, a worldwide leader in insurance and asset management, with 160,000 employees serving 108 million clients in 57 countries. Present in Singapore since 1969, AXA Insurance has been serving the general and life insurance needs of individuals and companies in Singapore through a wide range of innovative products. As one of the top global insurers in Singapore, AXA Insurance protects more than a third of a million customers in Singapore. As a company whose business is about protecting people, AXA Insurance is committed to building a stronger and safer society by empowering customers to live better lives. For more information, please visit www.axa.com.sg Discover a stimulating environment, based on excellence on a global scale. Are innovation and initiative important to you? Do you focus on solutions? Are you customer-orientated? We offer a wealth of career opportunities and a wide variety of positions in many fields. We want our employees to enjoy fulfilling careers and keep moving their careers in the right direction, whether at home or across the globe. Our size and diversity of activities means our people have many opportunities to evolve, by moving roles cross-functionally or internationally, based on their performance and aspirations. At AXA, all work and no play isn’t our way. We’re creating the future with more inclusive, agile work environments. Speak to us to find out more.

Job_Title: Finance Transformation – Regional Finance Transformation Initiatives Lead
Job_Descriptions: The Asia Finance Transformation Initiatives Lead, will be part of the Asia finance Transformation Office. The Asia Finance Transformation Office was recently established and is responsible for providing central oversight, Program governance, program planning and reporting for execution of Transformation Program in Asia Finance. This role will be responsible for bringing together the overall program for Asia Finance interfacing with Global Finance Transformation office (FTO) and Asia CAO Transformation teams creating integrated plans across all of the Asia Finance Functions and governing the programs being executed under the respective functions.  In addition, this role will be responsible for providing effective oversight of large programs, identifying and managing interdependencies between programs and providing transparency to senior stakeholders. Responsibilities: The responsibilities of the Regional Finance Transformation Office will be to seamlessly coordinate activities across multiple transformation and BAU teams and understand the commitments and outcomes designed by the Global teams, translating that to implementation in the regions while bringing back to these global teams the regional, cluster and countries perspectives. Ensure the required level of understanding and engagement in the Transformation efforts and ensure that the Transformation execution is uniform across region and countries avoiding the build up or deepening of silos. This would require Financial SME knowledge, in order understand the initiatives and manage cross dependencies across various functions and countries. Support the execution of the Finance Transformation to ensure success across the Finance Initiatives in the region, including Design and ensure consistent implementation of common PMO standards, reporting and closure process Appropriately assess risk and cross-enterprise dependencies when business decisions are made Provide reporting and informational updates to the Regional Finance Transformation Lead and collaborates with the Global FTO team to develop and ensure timely and consistent PMO status reporting Direct the communication of status, issue and risk disposition to all stakeholders, escalating any issues on a timely basis Lead effective communications to broad and diverse group of Regional and Global stakeholders Communicating with Senior Management on the Regional Finance Transformation progress Facilitating robust information flow between the teams Day to day ownership of respective Initiatives Transformation delivery Provides strategic direction and resolves issues escalated by global work-stream leads Collaborate with senior leadership across Finance groups in the region and globally and within the FTO sub-groups including Risk and Control, Architecture and Technology, Data and Governance Partner with business stakeholders to identify, from the regional perspective, business needs, validate pain points, and determine the high-level value proposition / business case for implementing innovative solutions via the FTO Partner closely with function leadership to inform and advise on both ongoing transformation work and areas of opportunity in the respective region Qualifications: 10-15+ years of experience leading transformation projects and organizational change, managerial experience preferred. Experience within the Financial Services or another regulated industry is preferred. Excellent working knowledge of at least two of the three key finance functions -  Financial Planning & Analysis, Treasury, Controller; Understanding of financials systems & tools within and outside Citi will be an advantage Exceptional communication, presentation and strategic thinking skills to engage with C-Suite leadership, and demystify technical intricacies in language and context relevant to a broader audience Track record of success in delivering high quality work in a fast paced and dynamic environment within a heavily matrixed organization Prior work experience in enterprise-wide transformation/organizational change initiatives related to analytics, management or strategy consulting in financial services areas with a focus on capital and business planning is preferred Strong Project Management skills and experience Strong business analysis competency with historic success in shaping opportunities via conceptual thinking and abstract problem-solving capabilities Analytical mindset to resolve issues in a variety of complex situations Excellent quantitative and qualitative skills; being able to analyze data, draw conclusions, identify trends and issues, and diagnose root cause of issues Integrity, maturity, dependability, a positive professional attitude Education: An undergraduate degree is required. An MBA, CPA or CFA is preferred ------------------------------------------------- Job Family Group: Finance ------------------------------------------------- Job Family: Fin Solutions Dsgn & Implement ------------------------------------------------------ Time Type: Full time ------------------------------------------------------ Citi is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. Citigroup Inc. and its subsidiaries ("Citi”) invite all qualified interested applicants to apply for career opportunities. If you are a person with a disability and need a reasonable accommodation to use our search tools and/or apply for a career opportunity review Accessibility at Citi . Description Who we are With a recent Series E raise of USD$325M from top investors like Tiger Global, Rokt is poised for rapid growth as we prepare for our IPO. Come join our growing team - operating in 19+ markets worldwide, with its headquarters in NYC, and a major R&D hub in Sydney. Listed as ‘Great Places to Work’ in the US and Australia, Rokt’s ecommerce technology helps companies like Live Nation, Groupon, Staples, Lands’ End, Fanatics, GoDaddy, Vistaprint and HelloFresh seize the full potential of every transaction moment to grow revenue and acquire new customers at scale. Our award-winning culture is guided by our five core values: Smart with Humility, Own the Outcomes, Force for Good, Conquer New Frontiers, and Enjoy the Ride. These values help us attract, engage, and develop the right talent around the globe and ensure we have the right conditions to do our best work. We are profitable, growing fast, and having fun transforming the world of e-commerce. Keen to join us? Learn more at rokt.com. Requirements About the role The Operations Executive role is an entry-level role suited for someone who enjoys tackling challenges and coming up with creative solutions. You’ll be a great candidate for this role if you love to be a part of an extremely high-performing team that sits at the heart of the business. Reporting to the Senior Manager of Operations, the Operations Executive role is part of the team that manages and executes on all technical implementations, client onboarding, QA, and troubleshooting. This particular role has a strong focus on both the backend and on the frontend look and feel of our client integrations as well as managing campaign configuration, troubleshooting, and reporting. You are a key piece of the puzzle that helps convert our customer objectives into results at Rokt. Outcomes & responsibilities Campaign and front end technical set up, review, troubleshooting, and optimization Campaign approvals to maintain compliance in the marketplace Creation of demo sites showcasing the Rokt technology on partner pages Work closely with sales and account management teams to ensure client implementations are built for success Setting up API and FTP data delivery tasks Perform technical audits of client pages Setup and manage experiments to determine the optimal client setup General onboarding and offboarding of Rokt employees First line of product support for both internal and external users Designing workflows and process improvements to drive efficiencies Capabilities & Requirements BA/BS degree or some relevant prior experience be it by way of permanent, casual, or internship role (digital/technology experience preferred) Fluency in Japanese is a requirement. Candidates must be a level N2+. Technical experience- HTML/CSS (JS is a plus) and familiarity with API integrations Effective communicator - able to simplify and effectively explain complex solutions to technical and non-technical audiences Creative problem solver - approaches all projects and tasks with a creative mindset in order to determine the appropriate solution Project management - highly organized and able to prioritize tasks effectively in a fast-paced environment Reacts well when placed under stressful conditions or pressure Required to work codepartmentally with several teams in order to accomplish goals. Positive attitude and able to enjoy the work they do Preferred experience with Microsoft Office, Tableau, Hubspot Experience with digital marketing platforms (e.g. adwords, Doubleclick) and analytics tools (e.g. Tableau) are a plus Benefits Work with the greatest talent in town . Our recruiting process is tough. We hold a high bar because we have a high performing, high-velocity culture - we only want the brightest and the best. Join a community . We believe the best things happen when we come together to solve complex problems and make meaningful connections with each other through interest groups, sports clubs, and social events. Accelerate your career . Develop through our global training events, ‘Level Up’ investment, online training courses, and our fantastic people leaders. Take your career to Rokt’speed - the average time between promotions is 12 months Take a break . When you work hard, we know you also need to rest. We offer generous time off and parental leave policies. We also offer a paid Rokt’star Sabbatical for employees who have been with us 3 years or more. Stay happy and healthy . Enjoy catered lunch 3 times a week and healthy snacks in the office. Plus join the gym on us! In the US, access generous retirement plans like a 4% dollar-for-dollar 401K matching plan and get fully funded premium health insurance for your whole family. Become a shareholder . All Rokt’stars have stock options. If we succeed, everyone enjoys the upside. See the world! Along with our global all-staff events in amazing locations (Phuket, Thailand in January 2020), we also offer generous relocation packages for those interested in moving to another Rokt office. We have cool offices in great cities - Tokyo, New York, Singapore, Boston, Sydney. We believe in equality . Rokt is an Equal Opportunity Employer and recognizes that a diverse workforce is crucial to our success as a business. We would love you to apply for one of our open roles - irrespective of socio-economic status or background, age, gender identity, race, religion, sexual orientation, color, pregnancy, carer/family responsibilities, national and social origin, political opinion, marital, veteran, or disability status. #LI-Hybrid

about the company Our organisation is a leader within the FMCG space, with a strong focus on mass market FMCG product lines. advantage DIVISION DESCRIPTION: Who We Are The Corporate and Workplace Solutions Division (CWS) focuses on commercial management, client support, advisory solutions, strategic planning, risk management, people security, real estate strategy and the enablement of collaboration and productivity tools across the firm. We deliver a world-class work experience and environment, managing the firm’s corporate real estate strategy, client engagement solutions, essential commercial and risk management functions and flexible digital workstyles that drive the firm’s operating efficiency and productivity. How We’re Organized Workplace Experience - Encompasses the comprehensive onsite workplace experience, how people interact with the workplace, on and off-site events and our overall location strategy. Departments include Events, Real Estate Strategy, Real Estate Development and On-Site Solutions, which is comprised of Document Management, Facilities, Ground Transportation and Hospitality. Spend Management - Encompasses the functions responsible for managing all aspects of the firm's spend with third parties -- advising commercial agreements, managing third party and payment risk and driving operating efficiency. Departments include Product Finance, Strategic Sourcing, Third Party Governance, Procure to Pay, Integrated Travel and Expense and Infrastructure and Transformation. CWS Engineering - Aligns several engineering functions focused on collaboration and productivity tools. Departments include Digital Workplace, Client and Production Engineering, Corporate Engineering , Spend, Data and Automation, Windows Engineering and Product Success and Delivery Engineering. Office of Global Security (OGS) - Protects the people and assets of Goldman Sachs to ensure a safe and secure environment. Assesses risk to enable the delivery of effective security, fire and life safety protocols and leads crisis management preparation, implementation and recovery processes. Includes Physical Security & Investigations, Executive Protection, Fire Safety and Crisis Management. Divisional Management (COO) - Aligns division-wide functions to drive strategic cohesiveness, consistency and efficiency. Departments include Business Unit Management, Communications and User Engagement, Risk and Environmental, Social & Governance.

Purpose To manage a team of technicians/junior staff in a specific engineering discipline (automation, instrumentation, electrical, mechanical or building services) to ensure timely implementation of projects and plant availability at all times. Key Responsibilities Carry out implementation activities for plant modifications, capital projects and other identified plant improvement projects in line with defined specifications, budget and qualification of facilities in accordance with site to approved procedures. Provides specialist advice to other departments and subordinates for trouble shooting / continuous improvements to process/systems Maintain the site equipment and facility to high GMP standard meeting the regulatory expectations such that the site is always inspection ready Implementation and execute of the Product Contamination Cause and Elimination (PCCE) program Provide input to the project team of capital projects as well as develop and implement the maintenance plan for newly installed equipment Provide site inputs to the development of Global Engineering Standards (GES) and Primary Supply Standard Engineering Practices (PMSEP) Monitor and enforce compliance measures (including safety) within their specific discipline to ensure inspection readiness of plant, as well as participate as an audit team member in the conduct of audits. Supervise, develop, and motivate junior staff to help realize their maximum potential so as to contribute towards achieving the objectives of the department. Contribute to the development of the annual operating budget of the section to ensure achievement operational targets of section Implementation of the GSK Production System (GPS) for Engineering Services Responsible for planning and implementing plant maintenance, managing of engineering resources during plant turnaround and prompt resolution of breakdowns, including engaging external assistance To support the development of facility master plan to ensure compliance to engineering standards, management of obsolescence and asset replacement Monitor and manage the defined utility system to ensure constant and reliable utility supply to the plant at all times so as to minimize disruption to the production process To support customer complaints and deviation investigations and ensure that all relevant engineering corrective actions are completed within the agreed timeline Prepare and issue Engineering Technical Report and provide input to Periodic Reviews and Annual Validation Report to ensure timely completion of the report. To manage the site computerized maintenance system and its data /records to ensure that the information is accurate and inspection ready at all time. To provide reports from the system and used as tools for maintenance decision Why you? Basic Qualifications: We are looking for professionals with these required skills to achieve our goals: At least 3 years of relevant experience in the process / pharmaceutical industry Good knowledge in Control systems both in maintenance and plant commissioning Familiar and understanding of GSK Global Engineering Standard (GES) Business Preferred Qualifications: If you have the following characteristics, it would be a plus: Bachelor’s degree in the relevant engineering discipline Strong written and verbal communications skills Familiarity with manufacturing systems and technologies Why GSK? Uniting science, talent, and technology to get ahead of disease together At GSK, we have already delivered unprecedented change over the past four years, improving R&D, becoming a leader in Consumer Healthcare, strengthening our leadership, and transforming our commercial execution. Now, we’re making the most significant changes we’ve made to our business in over 20 years. We’re on track to separate and create two new companies in 2022: New GSK with a leading portfolio of vaccines and specialty medicines as well as R&D based on immune system and genetics science; and a new world-leading consumer healthcare company of loved and trusted brands. With new ambition comes new purpose. For New GSK, this is to unite science, talent, and technology to get ahead of disease together – all with the clear ambition of delivering human health impact; stronger and more sustainable shareholder returns; and as a new GSK where outstanding people thrive. Getting ahead means preventing disease as well as treating it. How we do all this is through our people and our culture. A culture that is ambitious for patients – so we deliver what matters better and faster; accountable for impact – with clear ownership of goals and support to succeed; and where we do the right thing . So, if you’re ready to improve the lives of billions, join us at this exciting moment in our journey. Join our challenge to get Ahead Together. *Li-GSK Our goal is to be one of the world’s most innovative, best performing and trusted healthcare companies. We believe that we all bring something unique to GSK and when we combine our knowledge, experiences and styles together, the impact is incredible. Come join our adventure at GSK where you will be inspired to do your best work for our patients and consumers. A place where you can be you, feel good and keep growing. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact GSK's commercial and general procurement/human resources department to obtain prior written authorization before referring any candidates to GSK. The obtaining of prior written authorization is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and GSK. In the absence of such written authorization being obtained any actions undertaken by the employment business/agency shall be deemed to have been performed without the consent or contractual agreement of GSK. GSK shall therefore not be liable for any fees arising from such actions or any fees arising from any referrals by employment businesses/agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site.

Purpose Provide engineering and maintenance support to the manufacturing plants, utilities and site facilities operations to consistently deliver plant production target capacity by ensuring maximum plant availability through continuous improvement so that equipment and facilities are maintained and optimized in accordance to current Good Manufacturing Practices, Good Engineering Practices and in compliance with EHS requirements. Lead and manage a team of different disciplines to achieve the above purpose and drive performance. To maintain and manage all plant automation and control systems to consistently delivery plant production target capacity by ensuring maximum plant availability through continuous improvement with compliance to quality, EHS and regulatory requirements at the optimum cost. To support other Engineering disciplines and Operations to achieve the above objective Key Responsibilities Carry out preventive maintenance and optimization activities for the site automation and control systems. Provide supports for troubleshooting and start-up of the site automation, control systems Provide functional training on the site automation, control systems to plant personnel. Perform SAP transactions on Plant Maintenance module and co-ordinate predictive, preventive maintenance work, including breakdown maintenance and plant modification.  Ensure timely closure of work orders in M-ERP Support planning, coordinating and executing of plant shut down activities Support plant improvement initiatives and projects Update site standard operating procedures, work instructions and drawings associated with automation, control systems. Perform routine Level 1 EHS, quality and engineering audit to support inspection readiness Support in engineering performance management Support in Change Management via implementing automation and control system change in supporting routine improvement and projects Support in automation, control systems maintenance life cycle plan by conduct criticality assessment to determine maintenance priority and routinely updating of Facilities Master Plan (FMP) and trigger obsolete asset replacement via capital project. Perform automation and control system periodic reviews as per site periodic review plan Promote and embrace GSK Production System (GPS) to drive Safety, Quality, Supply Performance and Continuous Improvement (CI) projects that lead to overall safety, quality and cost improvement e.g. improve system reliability, standardization, etc. Why you? Basic Qualifications: We are looking for professionals with these required skills to achieve our goals: Degree in Electrical Engineering or Instrumentation and Control or Chemical Engineering or other engineering field. Minimum 3 years of relevant experience in pharmaceutical, chemical or petrol-chemical industry. Preferred Qualifications: If you have the following characteristics, it would be a plus: Knowledge of DeltaV DCS is essential Knowledge of Siemens PLC is advantage Good knowledge on batch process is advantage Knowledges of filed instrumentation in GxP environment is advantage Knowledge of SIL (Safety Integrity Level) study is advantage Knowledge of SAP is advantage Knowledge of GMP and EHS requirements Strong leadership and able to work independently Why GSK?
