Company Description Shopify is making enterprise commerce simple. We give high growth, high volume merchants the scalability, reliability and flexibility they need. Shopify is helping power commerce for companies like One Championship, Secretlab, Sennheiser, Nestle and many more. We believe large merchants should love their commerce platform and we work hard each day to make that happen. We are in hyper-growth, and this is where you come in… Job Description We are building a new sales team in Singapore for Southeast Asia Markets to help us drive our enterprise product Shopify Plus. Our Account Executives will work directly with brands in the region to understand and develop their commerce strategies and advise on how Shopify can help them meet their goals. This is a quota-carrying, hunter role where you’ll be working on things like: Generating Pipeline and closing Net new logos for Shopify   Understanding our customers’ unique business goals, needs, and challenges, helping them to grow their businesses with Shopify Solutions Creating a Point of View and Value proposition  Effectively moving your deals through the sales cycle to close Collaborating on projects within the team and with other Shopify teams to deliver the highest level of the merchant experience Work with multiple stakeholders in the business to deliver results (Marketing, Partnerships, Solution Engineers, Merchant Success) Qualifications You’ll need to have: 8+ years of experience selling SAAS & Cloud Software solutions for SEA markets experience selling into Indosesian market will be a plus Knowledge of E-commerce Experience working with SAAS Partners Managing a complex deal cycle  Experience in Value Selling  High energy and a strong work ethic drive the teams and individual goals Experience in working with global teams The ability to work in a self-directed manner, navigating through a fast-paced and ambiguous environment Excellent relationship, conversation, and influence skills Product knowledge and desire to become a Shopify expert for SEA Please note: This is a remote position, and the hire needs to be based in Singapore. Additional Information Shopify is now permanently remote, and we’re working towards a future that is digital by design. That location you see above? Consider it merely an example of hundreds of potential locations Shopify is hiring. Learn more here: https://www.shopify.com/careers/work-anywhere Our belief is that a strong commitment to diversity & inclusion enables us to truly make commerce better for everyone. We encourage applications from Indigenous peoples, racialized people, people with disabilities, people from gender and sexually diverse communities, and/or people with intersectional identities. Please take a look at our Sustainability Reports to learn more about Shopify’s commitments to our communities, and our planet.At Shopify, we understand that experience comes in many forms. We’re dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team - so if your experience is this close to what we’re looking for, please consider applying.

Assistant/Associate Director, Brand, Marketing & Communications Location: Other locations:  Primary Location Only Date:  23-Feb-2022 At EY, you will have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we are counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all. The candidate is accountable for providing successful leadership, management and governance of a range of integrated marketing and external and internal communications programs aimed at clients and prospects within the Consulting and Strategy and Transaction space. This individual will be responsible for working closely with senior leadership to develop platforms that will help differentiate EY’s brand by elevating awareness and driving programs that position our Consulting and Strategy practice as a preferred service provider. This role requires a dynamic, proactive marketer and communicator who is adept at moving from strategy to ground execution, commands strong understanding of B2B marketing, works well under pressure and excels at building strong relationships with senior-level stakeholders. The candidate will work with the Regional and Singapore Brand, Marketing and Communications Leader to: Plan, develop and deliver an integrated marketing and external and internal communications strategy covering PR/media, social /digital, sponsorship, events and communications with defined metrics and a focus on delivering results and business outcomes that build brand, expand relationships and ultimately drive revenue with clients and prospects Drive multi-format content strategy, including the development of a suite of differentiated digital and print communications Drive events and sponsorship opportunities, including delivery of physical and virtual events Commission material from subject matter resources within practice and work with them to develop thought leadership and publish-ready content Collaborate with media relations to execute media strategy, including giving input to proactive media plans Maintain up-to-date knowledge on issues and trends in the marketplace and the implications for BMC strategy Enhance sales enablement that supports eventual pipeline and revenue creation The position will have core responsibilities for Singapore and Asean. Experience: Undergraduate degree in marketing and communications (or equivalent area of study or experience) At least 12 years of relevant experience in a brand, marketing or communications role Excellent command of spoken and written English Experience in professional services, technology or B2B segment Competencies Ability to move from strategy to ground execution seamlessly Demonstrate the knowledge, skills and abilities needed to establish and refine the strategies that drive brand as well as organizational performance and add value to the business Impeccable project and stakeholder management skills and attention to quality and detail Assert own ideas and persuade others to gain support and commitment from stakeholders Demonstrate strong leadership and consensus-building skills in a dynamic environment Communicate the BMC value proposition to the business Proactively develop others; see learning and development as a critical input to delivering exceptional client service to BMC clients Be a point of integration and serve as an organizational connector across service lines; enable knowledge sharing throughout the Region and the BMC team EY | Building a better working world EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people, and society and build trust in the capital markets. Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform, and operate. Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax, and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

Role: Director of Sales, Nascent and Vietnam Work Location: Singapore Reports to: MD for SEA & Korea Region. Job Description VMware is a global leader in cloud infrastructure & management, application modernization, anywhere workspace and intrinsic security. Built on VMware's industry-leading technologies, our solutions deliver a new model of IT that is fluid, instant and more secure. Customers can innovate faster by rapidly developing, automatically delivering and more safely consuming any application. For more info: https://www.vmware.com/asean.html Why will you enjoy this new opportunity? You are driven by bringing together a team that delivers the next level of growth for our Nascent and Vietnam Business. By working collaboratively with your teams and an extended support system, you will harness the power of our solutions, our partners and bring them to market to ensure customer businesses can continue and accelerate their digital transformations. You love solving customer problems and learning new things and are looking for a company that helps enable those ideas. You are looking for an opportunity to work for a company whose software is utilized by every Fortune 500 company and significantly impacts every industry. You want to be a part of a collaborative environment whose teams care about the product they are creating, how they create it, and the impact it has on customers’ business objectives. You believe in building teams, empowering them and leading from the front for your top customers and partners. Exciting our teams, customers and partners, building the right environment internally where teams can be successful and do their best to deliver outcomes for customers and partners is core part of your success. We need someone who is passionate about phenomenal customer and partner outcomes, work collaboratively across VMware teams. You will drive overall success in the region for VMware. What are the performance goals over the first 6-12 months you will work towards completing? Within your first 3 months • Meet our customers, partners and employees. Develop relationships with the important stakeholders internally and externally. • Become competent in our solutions, offerings and how they apply to the problems our customers are facing and need our help • Understand, analyse and assess the market and our business. You will identify our top opportunities to improve, grow both internally and externally • Create a exciting environment internally where we can be agile, responsive and strategic by fostering a learning, collaborative and resilient culture for our teams. After 3 months • Build the strategic plan for the next growth phase for the country aligned to the overall company plan and direction • Create the execution plan, align the resources, map the KPI’s and translate the strategy into a strong executable plan • Continuous focus on delivering the current business through excellence across sales and partnerships. • Coaching and hiring top talent and building the next generation of leaders for the business • Representing VMware in the country and supporting the country priorities through our strategic engagements in place. • Contribute to the overall community through technology and non-technology initiatives that make us a strong part of the ecosystem in the country • Help VMware be a trusted advisor to our top customers for their transformation strategies & leverage VMware internal ecosystem to work on a joint vision, strategy and technical/solution roadmap What type of work will you be doing? What assignments, requirements or skills will you be performing on a regular basis? As a Sales Director for VMWare Nascent and Vietnam, you will be: • Mentoring and coaching sales leaders in your teams to achieve their objectives in their businesses. • Drive a cohesive strategy through sales, marketing, services and many other functions that contribute to your business. • Work closely with the top customer and partner executive and represent VMware across the countries. • Utilize the operations and cadences to ensure the teams are delivering, are being supported to be successful and we can identify opportunities and risks in the business. • Planning, deploying, aligning resources to ensure the best outcome for the teams, customers and VMware. • You have experience and skills in managing a large business at scale, leading large transformation engagements for top customers in the region. • You have relationships with the key stakeholders, customers and partners in the market. • You have led teams successfully in the past to grow them and create a environment of growth and collaboration • You have a demonstrated proficiency as a leader of sales teams in a professional sales environment in a similar environment and scale. What is the leadership like for this role? What is the structure and culture of the team like? This position reports to Paul Simos - MD of SEAK (South East Asia and Korea). It sits on the leadership team for SEAK and is a strong contributor to the overall SEAK business and strategy. It leads a large team across many different functions and brings a one VMware culture and operating model. The team culture is based on trust and collaboration with a very successful track record. The opportunity is for someone to grow the leadership, continue to deliver on the exceptional track record and bring the next level of growth for the company. Category : Sales Subcategory: Field Sales Experience: Business Leadership Full Time/ Part Time: Full Time Posted Date: 2022-02-23 VMware Company Overview: At VMware, we believe that software has the power to unlock new opportunities for people and our planet. We look beyond the barriers of compromise to engineer new ways to make technologies work together seamlessly. Our cloud, mobility, and security software form a flexible, consistent digital foundation for securely delivering the apps, services and experiences that are transforming business innovation around the globe. At the core of what we do are our people who deeply value execution, passion, integrity, customers, and community. Shape what’s possible today at http://careers.vmware.com. ROLE DESCRIPTION: The Asia Head of Productivity is a core part of the leadership team of Citi’s Global Productivity organization, as well as a trusted resource and advisor for members of the Asia Operating Committee. The Asia Head of Productivity must source and lead significant programs on behalf of the Asia Leadership Team.  Each of these efforts should also be in support of Citi Global Productivity’s goals to develop Citi’s approaches and methods; to build change capabilities across Citi; and to engage Citi employees at all levels in transformational change. As the leader of the Productivity function in Asia, the Head works closely with the Citi Asia’s Operating Committee and senior executives to define and execute an agenda of projects and programs to support operating model changes, business effectiveness improvements, digitization, culture change, and business transformation.  In addition, the Asia Head of Productivity should be a thought-leader, providing unique perspective on an array of strategic, operational, and communication questions for senior leadership The Asia Head of Productivity develops and applies methodologies, in the specific context of the Asia business, to provide hands-on leadership and support to specific Citi operating model, digitization and business process improvement projects and programs, and also provides oversight for projects undertaken by the Productivity organization that have a significant process improvement or process change component.   Projects will vary in size, duration, and complexity; will have measurable business value outcomes; and will have senior management to Executive-level sponsorship. In addition to participating on operating model, digitization, process improvement and process transformation projects and programs, the Asia Head of Productivity serves as a thought and methodology leader relative to process analysis, design, and implementation approaches and methods to be leveraged on projects undertaken by the Productivity organization.  As such, while the individual’s primary responsibility is to support the Asia business and its leadership, the Asia Head of Productivity should also build and develop Citi Productivity’s approach for delivery of operating model, digitization, process Improvement and process Transformation, integrating with the Head of Productivity and other leaders within the group to train team members on the approach and develop and evolve a knowledgebase to support a broad range of Process Improvement and Process Transformation projects and teams across Citi. With close relationships across Citi’s Institutional Clients Group, Global Consumer Bank, Global Functions, and Enterprise Operations and Technology, the Asia Head of Productivity can provide guidance and context to the broader Productivity team as to how a methodology will be received or interpreted by a range of senior leaders The Asia Head of Productivity reports directly to the Global Head of Productivity and has a matrix line to the Asia CFO.  This person manages teams of Engagement Managers and Associates assigned to operating model, business effectiveness, digitization, culture change, and business process transformation projects. Performance will be measured by a combination of individual and team metrics including value return on process improvement and transformation projects and programs, stakeholder feedback, and contribution to thought and team leadership. RESPONSIBILITIES: Partnering with the Asia CFO and other leaders on the Asia Operating Committee, set an agenda of key initiatives and priorities to drive transformational change in Citi Asia’s business model, Partner with business stakeholders to scope and launch operating model, process improvement and process transformation projects, applying agile principles, by identifying business needs, validating key pain points, and determining the business case for change.  Use hypotheses development, data analysis / analytics, and process mapping tools and methods to establish project scope and potential value.  Conduct and incorporate research and competitive analysis as required. Partner with business stakeholders to devise innovative solutions through leveraging an agile methodology to address process pain points and value opportunities.  Plan and conduct functional and cross-functional working sessions to develop future state process models that address value opportunities.  Conduct and incorporate leading practice assessments and benchmarking as required. Lead Engagement Managers and Associates through the development of project plans, including backlogs and user stories, establishment of Steering Team(s), and mobilization and launch of project teams to support operating model, process improvement and process transformation project launch.  Train project managers / team leaders on agile principles (preferred), process analysis and design approaches, methods, and tools. Help create culture change within Citi. Reduce time to market, boost quality, raise employee morale and become a more adaptive organization. QUALIFICATIONS: 15+ years of experience leading Strategy, Operating Model, Digitization, Business Process Transformation, and Culture programs for end-to-end processes crossing business areas / siloes.  Served as the project / program lead on at least 5 major complex operating model, digitization, process reengineering or transformation projects, using agile methodologies, that delivered significant ROI and which were sponsored by Senior to Executive management. Financial Services and Management Consulting experience are required. Consistent track record drafting and delivering communications for C-Suite and Board of Directors Experience in Asia, understanding the complexities of the business, regulatory, and talent environments across the region. Proven capability to develop / adapt Process improvement and Process Transformation approaches and methods, and to lead and train others on the approaches and methods. Demonstrated track record of positively impacting organizations and transitioning work, processes, and employees to higher value business models. Ability to lead and manage a cross-functional project team and 1 – 5 direct team members plus 10+ stakeholders on key Business Process Transformation, Strategy, and/or Culture approaches.  Proven experience in coaching and developing direct reports and team members. COMPETENCY REQUIREMENTS: Required Competencies: Problem Identification and Structuring Executive Communication Business Process Improvement & Design Operational KPI Development, Measurement, and Analysis Business Case Development and Tracking Agile Delivery (preferred, but not required Functional Knowledge (some of the below): Finance Human Resources Risk Management Legal Compliance Consumer and Institutional Banking CHARACTERISTICS: Strong leadership skills and presence; can lead through influence / without formal authority Can work effectively in a team-based collaborative leadership model to build and ramp-up an organization Thinks business first but quickly grasps and can be conversant in digital technologies and their application to business processes Innovative and curious, and readily able to think outside of the box Communicates effectively and impactfully to all levels of an organization, from line workers to Board members; proficient to expert use of Powerpoint presentation for story-telling relative to the business case for change, the results of analysis, and the plan forward Self-starter who brings high sense of urgency to assignments and goals Comfortable with ambiguity and change Passionate about Citi Asia returns and meeting the needs of our clients Has strong project management skills but deploys a flexible approach to meet the needs of a broad group of diverse stakeholders Balances analytical and creative abilities ------------------------------------------------- Job Family Group: Business Strategy, Management & Administration ------------------------------------------------- Job Family: Business Process Re-Engineering ------------------------------------------------------ Time Type: Full time ------------------------------------------------------ Citi is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. Who we are: At Wunderman Thompson we exist to inspire growth for ambitious brands. Part creative agency, part consultancy and part technology company, our experts provide end-to-end capabilities at a global scale to deliver inspiration across the entire brand and customer experience. We are 20,000 strong in 90 markets around the world; our people bring together creative storytelling, diverse perspectives, inclusive thinking, and highly specialized vertical capabilities to drive growth for our clients. We offer deep expertise across the entire customer journey, including communications, commerce, consultancy, CRM, CX, data, production, and technology. As Associate Account Director (AAD), you will be responsible for identifying and qualifying new revenue opportunities within existing clients, creating client interest in new deliverables, and supporting with new business proposals. You will be central in translating our client’s vision into business requirements, reviewing team deliverables, providing strategic oversight, and bringing the right mix of agency capabilities to the forefront in response to briefs. You will possess high expertise on digital trends and technologies and have a hunger for continuing your professional development. As a Team Lead: You will be a mentor to your direct reports and provide support however and wherever needed. You lead from a place of empathy and compassion working hard to balance the needs of our clients, business, and your reports. You are an ambassador who fosters knowledge sharing across team members, either locally or regionally. What you’ll do: For your clients’ - Develop overall account strategy and translate the client’s vision and needs into business requirements through proper coordination with project teams on required deliverables, and client expectations. Identify opportunities and new interests that the client may not recognize to help drive revenue and benefit business needs as their digital advisor. Produce proposals and presentations that win additional business. This includes developing and negotiating statements of work, ensure work is delivered on budget, and manage invoicing according to the contract terms. Be a role model for stewardship between the client and the agency by balancing the account’s needs with avoiding unnecessary expenditures and negotiation required costs Work closely with project teams to ensure effective scoping of work and support them in delivering the highest quality work. Anticipate, proactively address, and advise management on potential client or revenue issues. For your team/ peers - Manages team members to help them develop their skills and drive their performance as well as optimizing the company’s capabilities to enhance strategic value. Share your knowledge and groom the next tranche of talent within the agency Engender a culture that promotes a safety in the workplace, mental wellbeing, inclusivity, and openness above all What you’ll need: Min. 7 years of client contact experience in a creative agency, communications, or customer service environment; demonstrated impact on the communication and online strategy for major clients. Outstanding ability to lead, convince, and inspire in a client-service environment; superior listening, interviewing, meeting facilitation, presentation, and writing skills. High knowledge and expertise in digital – and personal perspective on Internet trends and technologies, business and site performance analysis, user-centered design process. Proven ability to lead, mentor, and collaborate in a team-oriented workplace. Prior leadership role at growth-oriented creative or interactive firm. At Wunderman Thompson, we are committed to actively building a diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace where everyone feels welcomed, valued and heard, and is treated with dignity and respect.  As leaders and creative partners across industries, it is our responsibility to cultivate an environment reflective of our greatest asset; our people. We believe that this commitment inspires growth and delivers equitable outcomes for everyone as well as the clients and communities we serve. Wunderman Thompson is a WPP agency.  For more information, please visit our website and follow Wunderman Thompson on our social channels via Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, and Instagram. Job_Title: Partner Engagement Technical Program Manager, HBO Max
Job_Descriptions: Company Overview WarnerMedia is a powerful portfolio of iconic entertainment, news, and sports brands. We bring people, technology, and the world’s best storytellers together to drive culture and meaningful connection. We believe the enduring power of stories can open our eyes to the world, to each other, and to new and different perspectives. Join us. Shape your story here. The Job The Partner Engagement TPM role is a critical component in the launch and management of cutting edge consumer and B2B technologies in the Direct To Consumer (DTC)/International OTT organization at HBO Max. The primary function of the TPM is coordinating with the development teams owning the middleware authentication technology for TVE/OTT streaming apps. This middleware also services HBO Max business partners and client consumer facing digital properties accessible via web, mobile, gaming consoles, smart set-top boxes, and smart TVs. As part of the technology organization, the TPM is the product owner for this middleware. The TPM facilitates communication with internal business units, affiliates and channel partners to ensure we are developing the necessary product features to meet market demand. The TPM works closely with engineering teams to implement enhancements and other changes across our digital properties. The Daily Tracks three core areas of the technology organization: middleware core product development, affiliate integrations and channel partner integrations. Customer facing role with strong communication skills; ability to negotiate in a high pressure environment; acts as primary contact with Channel Partners and Affiliate clients for all technology middleware (aggregator) communications. Guide HBO teams, customers and partners in understanding overall technology product strategy as it applies to multiple product lines. Creates and executes end-to-end product strategies and lifecycles for multiple related product lines, and clearly communicates to stakeholders throughout the organization. Actively participate in architecture and design discussions with engineering teams across the entire company to help influence design and stability across the system. Defines, measures and tracks product related goals and metrics using a data driven approach with emphasis on evidence based decision making. Drives and owns the product requirements process across multiple related product lines while working collaboratively with key stakeholders to prioritize and validate technology, features, product direction and strategy. Develops product portfolio strategy and roadmap in concert with product management, engineering, marketing, sales, design and other internal teams and stakeholders. Acts as the product expert and resource within the organization for assigned product lines. Highly focused on affiliate integrations; tracks and communicates project deadlines and progress; drives schedules from conception to release to ensure that milestones are reached according to established timelines. Coordinates requirements gathering and testing activities to ensure schedules are met and resources allocated accordingly. Assists with the prioritization of bugs or enhancements and communicates related information to the development teams. Escalates issues to the development teams and follows up to ensure accurate and timely resolution. Develops effective methods of communicating information across functional teams so that critical tasks are assigned and completed in an accurate and timely manner. Communicates all key project plans, schedules, and scope changes to stakeholders. Manages relationships and coordinates work between different teams. The Essentials Bachelor’s degree in electrical or computer engineering or related field. Professional certificates such as Scrum Product Owner (CSPO) and Project Management Professional (PMP) certifications are highly advantageous. 6 or more years’ progressively responsible product development and project management experience. Multi-lingual written and spoken communication (English and APAC regional languages) to liaise with stakeholders across the region. Advanced knowledge of Agile software development; product, program and portfolio management and program rights management. Skill in using logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions or approaches to problems. Ability to build consensus and work effectively with cross-functional teams. Ability to manage multiple priorities to ensure that deadlines are met. Ability to use advanced features of department/ organization specific software. Ability to be flexible to join occasional evening meetings to accommodate  US and EMEA time zones. The Perks Exclusive WarnerMedia events and advance screenings Paid time off every year to volunteer for eligible employees Access to well-being tools, resources, and freebies Access to in-house learning and development resources Part of the WarnerMedia family of powerhouse brands Warner Media, LLC and its subsidiaries are equal opportunity employers. Qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, mental or physical disability, and genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status or any other category protected by law.

Job_Title: Regional Quality and Safety Management Manager
Job_Descriptions: DSM – Bright Science. Brighter Living.™ Royal DSM is a global, purpose-led, science-based company active in Nutrition, Health and Sustainable Living. DSM’s purpose is to create brighter lives for all. DSM addresses with its products and solutions some of the world’s biggest challenges while simultaneously creating economic, environmental and societal value for all its stakeholders – customers, employees, shareholders, and society at large. DSM delivers innovative solutions for human nutrition, animal nutrition, personal care and aroma, medical devices, green products and applications, and new mobility and connectivity. DSM and its associated companies deliver annual net sales of about €10 billion with approximately 23,000 employees. The company was founded in 1902 and is listed on Euronext Amsterdam. More information can be found at www.dsm.com. The Regional Quality and Safety Management Manager (Romer Labs) is responsible for ensuring the Regional Business Unit (RBU) complies with applicable Quality Management (QM) standards, which include Group Integrated Management System (IMS) standards, local regulations, requirements and site certified QM standards. Coordinate QM audits to maintain QM certification status and ensure compliance for ISO9001 Certifications and Singapore bizSAFE Level 3 Certifications.  Support execution of the plan, in order to provide an injury-free and incident-free workplace and to prevent all work-related disabilities or health problems. These are your tasks and responsibilities we trust in you: Implement routine Quality Management (QM) work including new staff QM training, annual QM training, Hazard Analysis and Critical Control Points (HACCP) validation and mock recall according to Group standards Strengthen the Business Unit / Regional Business Unit (BU/RBU) Integrated Management System (IMS) concept byS of relevant processes on IMS standards and implementing routinely on-site inspection Routinely report to Group concerning the current (Regional) Business Unit (BU/RBU) Integrated Management System (IMS) status via IMS management review report and two-way meetings Handle customer complaints to fulfill customer satisfaction Conduct Risk Assessment (RA) and action plans on processes for compliance to local workplace health and safety government regulations Align and arrange for external and internal Integrated Management System (IMS) audits within the Group integration Coordinate the investigation and close out of the (Regional) Business Unit (BU/RBU) site Provide progress and support to drive internal audit corrective actions Quarterly update the Integrated Management System (IMS) Report on the Management 2.0 database Identify and remedy gaps between the Business Unit / Regional Business Unit (BU/RBU) Quality Management (QM) system and Group QM standards, site certified QM standards, under guidance from Deploy Management of Change System in laboratories, logistics and warehouses in compliance with requirements from authorities, customers, or internal regulations in the Quality/Regulatory and SHE areas. Ensure that the SHE management system is in place, maintained, improved and evaluated regularly Audit compliance with SHE requirements, best practices and relevant laws and regulations. Participate in regular inspections In order to leave your footprint with us, you need the following skills: Minimum Bachelor of Science in Quality Management, Biotechnology, Biomedical Science or equivalent 5 years of relevant experience in quality management and quality system development Strong leadership capabilities and established track record in effective leadership talents which includes people development in quality Proven track record of achievement in a prior quality and safety management position Demonstrate strong project management skills. Prior training in ISO9001 Auditor for Quality Management System will be an added advantage Preferably working knowledge of food safety diagnostic kits Possess excellent written, oral communication and presentation skills Highly dedicated and quality culture driven with a high degree of personal motivation Demonstrate strong passion to understand and network with Quality Management industry Our culture: Pioneers, Partners & Performers. That means for you: Regular participation in the most important national and international fairs and industry events You are part of an international team which operates globally The Procedure & Contact Interested in this position? Summary: Set up and operate a variety of machine tools to produce precision machine parts and instruments. This includes precision instruments, fabricate, modify and repair mechanical tools or maintain industrial machines, applying knowledge of machining, shop mathematics, metal properties, layout, and machining procedures Work Scope: Calculate dimensions and tolerances using knowledge of mathematics and instruments such as micrometers and Vernier calipers Machines parts to specifications using machines tools such as lathes, milling machines, shapers, or grinders. Measure, examines, and test completed units in order to detect defects and ensure conformance to specification, using precision instruments such as micrometers. Set up, adjust, and operate all of the basic machine tools and many specialized or advanced variation tools in order to perform precision machining operations. Study sample parts, blueprints, drawing, and engineering information in order to determine methods and sequences of operations needed to fabricate products, and determine product dimensions and tolerances. Observe and listen to operating machines or equipment in order to diagnose machine malfunction and to determine the need for adjustments or repairs. Maintain industrial machines, applying knowledge of machining, shop mathematics, metal properties, layout, and machining procedures. Clean and lubricate machines, tools, and equipment in order to remove grease, rust, stains, and foreign matter. Support metalworking projects from planning and fabrication through assembly, inspection, and testing, using knowledge of machines functions, metal properties and mathematics. Manager, Global Ocean Product Company Description About Toll Group At Toll, we do more than just logistics - we move the businesses that move the world. Our 20,000 team members can help solve any logistics, transport, or supply chain challenge – big or small. We have been supporting our customers for more than 130 years. Today, we support more than 20,000 customers worldwide with 500 sites in 25 countries, and a forwarding network spanning 150 countries. We are proudly part of Japan Post — www.tollgroup.com Job Description We are looking for a Manager - Global Ocean Product to join our Global Forwarding Division based in Singapore. You will support the SVP Global Ocean Freight in all commercial aspects of ocean freight in line with the global ocean strategy. The role As a Manager - Global Ocean Product, you will be responsible for: Preparing and updating of ocean product marketing presentations on monthly basis - research, collect and study/analyse market intel on global basis and trade specific Liaising with carriers and managing all administration related to carrier VID and credit terms Being the point of contact with Legal department to review and execute ocean related agreements (carrier VID agreements, credit agreement, vendor service agreement etc.); ensuring compliance with corporate policies and ERF procedures Supporting carrier/ vendor/customer meetings and/or communication where required. Maintaining carrier contact matrix at executive/regional/country levels Communicating with team members to ensure all are fully aligned with overall team goals, work cohesively and in harmony for the optimal output Ensuring adequate and broad access to report sources in various aspects (volumetric, financial, marketing, etc.) to fulfil ad-hoc reporting requirements from management. Supporting and tracking performance of ocean wholesale business. Qualifications About you To be successful in this role, you will need: Experience in ocean freight, supply chain logistics globally/regionally Experience with Commercial Contracts and Tender contracting Strong Marketing & Communications experience Expertise in MS Office software Additional information Be Connected With a bold vision and innovative drive, join our 20,000 colleagues as we lead industry change and transform how customers best meet their global supply chain needs in a meaningful and sustainable way. There are countless opportunities to learn and make a real impact in shaping our industry’s future. Grow with diverse challenges amongst a friendly and inclusive global culture. Take pride in building relationships that matter, because being connected is at the centre of what makes Toll great – it’s what makes our possibilities endless. Toll embraces and celebrates a variety of cultures. We continue to build a business that reflects the values of equality, built on the knowledge and understanding that everyone is welcome including the First Nations Peoples and those of all ages, genders and abilities. Challenging. Surprising. Fast-paced. Purposeful. Life at Bloomberg is many things, but it’s never dull. We’re a truly global business with a truly diverse workforce. We pride ourselves on being open, inclusive and collaborative — and in providing a work environment that inspires our employees to be their best. At Bloomberg we work on purpose. All of us engage in meaningful work, delivering leading edge products and solutions that shape the industry and are critical to our customers. You’ll also get to work at a company that lives its values and provides employees with opportunities to give back. Whether you thrive on the energy of a newsroom, the pace of a trading floor, or the buzz of a recent tech breakthrough, we’ll give you more than a job. We’ll give you the opportunity to do amazing work you couldn’t do anywhere else. Our team: We’re the Financial Solutions Recruitment team, with colleagues across Hong Kong, Shanghai, Singapore, London and New York. We manage full lifecycle recruitment for roles across Bloomberg's Financial Solutions division – a division that occupies the frontlines of Bloomberg’s global business through creating meaningful relationships with our customers by understanding their needs and helping develop products and services that exceed them. Through the Bloomberg Terminal and our fully integrated suite of Enterprise Solutions we provide our customers with the tools they need to navigate global business and financial markets — and the understanding they need to make smarter, faster decisions. We identify and hire the best talent across a diverse slate of professionals from Sales and Account Managers to Product and Workflow specialists. Multi-talented people who want – and are up to – the challenge of doing work that will make a global impact. That means hiring at various levels of experience, finding a place for people who can demonstrate their expertise and prove their track record. Who you are: You are an energetic, commercial, creative and collaborative recruiter who believes that talent is the fuel that makes an organisation go round. You don’t just transact but inject advice, well thought out sourcing strategies and key market insights at every step of the recruiting process. You’re also not shy when it comes to partnering with your clients to help identify and hire the best and brightest diverse talent, as well as building your internal and external networks. You bring a deep commitment to building an inclusive workforce, person by person and team by team. Finally, you know the APAC financial services landscape well and just how critical it is to find the right problem solvers, doers, leaders and innovators in order to compete in a marketplace of emergent platforms, products and talent. We'll trust you to: Fully understand the current and future talent needs and challenges of your respective businesses, working with team leaders and managers to build and execute effective talent acquisition strategies Manage the full lifecycle recruitment process for mid-to-senior level hires, from writing job descriptions, to reviewing resumes, interviewing candidates, offer negotiation/closing, and onboarding Adopt a hi-touch recruitment approach throughout all this process, be it through regular feedback to candidates, hiring managers and other internal stakeholders Directly source talent, through internal and external means, both for open roles as well as building future pipeline Interpret and leverage internal and external market data to influence and drive strategic initiatives Work closely with your HR stakeholders - Business partners, Talent Leadership & Development, Diversity & Inclusion, Employee Relations, and Immigration, to be an effective and trusted strategic partner to your business stakeholders Have a holistic talent management view through building strong working relationships with regional and global HR peers, to identify opportunities and challenges impacting your businesses, and driving strategic initiatives collaboratively Stay on top of market, employment and macro trends affecting the various departments across Financial Solutions Partner with internal stakeholders and communities as well as external organisations, to continuously improve and enhance our diverse recruitment strategies Represent the Bloomberg brand in every interaction You'll need to have: 8+ years of recent recruiting experience, including successful recruitment of experienced professionals within the Financial Services space with a combination of agency/search firm and in-house experience Experience in collaborating and aligning with internal HR and business stakeholders across the region A clear understanding of what finance people are about and what kinds of roles they play and aspire to The ability to execute on recruiting assignments and the aptitude to make decisions independently with limited information Strong relationship management and negotiation skills; a consultative approach; the ability to influence multiple stakeholders without direct authority; and network effectively within a global matrixed organisation Strong candidate assessment and interviewing skills Experience using applicant tracking systems, human resources information systems, and other recruiting-related applications You communicate and present to senior stakeholders and executives with ease Fluency in both written and spoken English Passionate about what you do, emotionally intelligent, and always leads by example Be forward looking, constantly looking for gaps and seizing opportunities Demonstrated continuous career growth within an organisation We'd love to see: Leadership experience, having developed people to deliver and achieve at their full potential Experience implementing successful diversity sourcing strategies/campaigns If this sounds like you: Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch with you to let you know the next steps but in the meantime feel free to browse this: http://www.bloomberg.com/professional Bloomberg is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate and are inclusive of age, disability, colour, gender, gender identity, marital status, national origin, race, religion and belief, parental or caring status, pregnancy or maternity/parental leave, sexual orientation, veteran status. Position Overview: Omnivision Technologies is a leading developer of advanced digital imaging solutions, with best-in-class CMOS image sensor technology. In Singapore ASIC Design Centre, you would be part of an experienced and talented design team to develop Camera Processor SoC, with integrated artificial intelligence & image signal processing, for smart home, security, automotive & IoT applications. From innovative video processor architectures, to neural processor design, you can have a hand in breakthroughs and reinventing the digital world. Responsibilities: You would be part of a dynamic digital IC design team that develops state-of-the art video processing, neural processing, advanced video analytics accelerators, and the entire Camera Processor SoC. You would be responsible for the successful implementation of the designs in Verilog/SystemVerilog coding, metrics measurement to meet key objectives & results, and follow-through in comprehensive verifications to successful silicon. Requirements: Experience in micro-architecture design, and RTL coding with Verilog/SystemVerilog. Experience in synthesis, with analysis of power, timing and area. Disciplined, quality-minded, and highly driven for excellence. Excellent team player and good communication skills. MSEE/BSEE in Electrical Engineering or Computer Engineering. Candidates with relevant experiences would be offered as Senior or Staff, taking on higher responsibilities. Experience in video processing and video analytics is a plus. Experience in UVM verification methodology is a plus. Passionate and strong in general programming is a plus.

Program Manager A Day in the Life Responsible for the overall direction, coordination, implementation, execution, control and completion of specific projects ensuring consistency with company strategy, commitments and goals. Oversees and manages the operational aspects of ongoing projects and serves as liaison between project management and planning, project team, and line management. Manages the development and implementation process of a company’s products and services involving departmental or cross-functional teams focused on the delivery of new or existing products and processes. Reviews status of projects and budgets; manages schedules and prepares status reports. Monitors the project from initiation through delivery. Assesses project issues and develops resolutions to meet productivity, quality, and client-satisfaction goals and objectives. Develops mechanisms for monitoring project progress and for intervention and problem solving with project managers, line managers, and clients. Gathers requirements, works on requirements planning, requirements elicitation and requirements management to ensure they meet demands of project’s key stakeholders. Communicates with stakeholders, obtains stakeholder engagement to ensure the end products or processes will solve the business problems. Executes project in accordance with project management system, processes, and methodologies. Identifies risks and critical paths in projects and work with project team to provide mitigation plan; and proactively escalates critical issues. Develops project management processes and methodologies as appropriate to improve efficiency and effectiveness, and to the changing business model and corporate goals. Works and implements projects on ad-hoc basis as required by business and operations needs and to work on assignment as tasked by direct manager. Mentor and coach junior project leaders. Complies with and help to enforce standard policies and procedures. Must Have: Minimum Requirements Bachelors degree required Minimum of 5 years of relevant experience, or advanced degree with a minimum of 3 years of relevant experience Experience managing suppliers and collaborate with our business partners based in China Nice to Have Prefer to have 8 years of relevant experience in project management Experience in managing global projects and global teams Proven experience in managing stakeholders’ relationship and expectation Proven experience in budget and resource planning Process improvement skill, ability to analyze and validate data, and being results oriented are key to success Knowledge of both theoretical and practical aspects of project management Knowledge of project management techniques, tools and software Experience in healthcare or medical products will be an added advantage Experience in Industry 4.0 or equivalent will be an added advantage Qualification in project management (such as certified PMP, PRINCE2, IPMA) or equivalent will be an added advantage Understanding of Lean Six Sigma methodology will be an added advantage About Medtronic Together, we can change healthcare worldwide. At Medtronic, we push the limits of what technology, therapies and services can do to help alleviate pain, restore health and extend life. We challenge ourselves and each other to make tomorrow better than yesterday. It is what makes this an exciting and rewarding place to be. We want to accelerate and advance our ability to create meaningful innovations - but we will only succeed with the right people on our team. Let’s work together to address universal healthcare needs and improve patients’ lives. Help us shape the future. Microsoft is on a mission to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. Our culture is centered on embracing a growth mindset, a theme of inspiring excellence, and encouraging teams and leaders to bring their best each day. In doing so, we create life-changing innovations that impact billions of lives around the world. You can help us to achieve our mission. Microsoft aspires to help our customers achieve their own digital transformation, leveraging the power of Microsoft Cloud solutions and support offerings. To this end, Microsoft invests in a dedicated Customer Success team that will help Microsoft customers successfully realize their business outcomes. Azure is the most comprehensive, innovative and flexible cloud platform today and Microsoft is hiring professionals that will drive customer cloud adoption within the most important companies in the market. We are always learning. Insatiably curious. We lean into uncertainty, take risks, and learn quickly from our mistakes. We build on each other’s ideas because we are better together. We stand in awe of what humans dare to achieve and are motivated every day to empower others to do more and achieve more through our technology and innovation. Together we make a difference. To learn more about Microsoft’s mission, please visit: https://careers.microsoft.com/mission-culture Check out all of our products at: http://www.microsoft.com/en-us We are looking for a highly motivated and passionate Cloud Solution Architect with extensive experience in the databases and advanced analytics to drive high priority customer initiatives on the Microsoft Azure Platform in collaboration with customers. This is a customer facing role, owning overall technical relationship between customer and Microsoft on all projects that leverage the Azure Data, Advanced Analytics and Machine Learning Platform. You will own the Data Platform & Advanced Analytics technical customer engagements including architectural design sessions, specific implementation projects and/or MVPs. The ideal candidate will have experience in customer-facing roles and success leading deep technical architecture discussions and hands-on architectural work with senior customer executives, Enterprise Architects, IT Management and Developers to drive Data Platform and Advanced Analytics solutions to production. Responsibilities Subject matter expertise in one or more of the following: Data Lakes : architected and implemented data lakes for analytics, leveraging open source or commercial Big Data technologies such as Apache Spark, Presto, Databricks, Cloudera/Hortonworks/MapR, Hadoop, Hive; Data Warehousing : designed and deployed data warehouses, mastering the design of ETL data processing pipelines and distributed databases for analytics such as Teradata, Oracle Exadata, IBM Netezza, SAP (HANA, BW), Azure SQL Data Warehouse, Azure Synapse Analytics, AWS Redshift, Google BigQuery, SQL Server. Adopted orchestrators to schedule the data processing pipelines such as Airflow, Azure Data Factory, AWS Glue. Experience in data visualization with platforms like Power BI or Tableau; Real-time Analytics : architected and implemented real-time analytics systems, leveraging open source or commercial technologies such as Apache Kafka, Spark Streaming, Flink, Azure EventHub and Stream Analytics, AWS Kinesis, IBM InfoSphere Streams; ML and MLOps : designed platforms to enable data scientists training and deploying ML models, and gained a good understanding of the toolchain for MLOps (matured experience with setting up CI/CD pipelines on Github or Gitlab; ML services such as Azure ML, Databricks, AWS SageMaker, SAS; deployed ML models on Kubernetes for scoring or on DBs for in-database inferences); NoSQL Databases (open source and commercial): experience with NoSQL and graph distributed DBs such as Azure CosmosDB, Gremlin APIs, AWS Neptune, Neo4J, AWS DynamoDB, MongoDB, Cassandra, HBase. Telenor Group is a leading telecommunications company across the Nordics and Asia with 188 million customers. We are committed to responsible business conduct and driven by the ambition of empowering societies. Connectivity has been Telenor’s domain for more than 160 years, and our purpose is to connect our customers to what matters most. We have a leading Nordic position in mobile, broadband and TV services, as well as substantial activities in subsidiaries and joint venture operations, including mobile financial services and online classifieds in the Asia region. Worldwide, Telenor Group and our operations’ teams are 16,000 people strong. Telenor Procurement Company (TPC), established in 2017 and headquartered in Singapore, operates as a subsidiary of the Telenor Group. We deliver Global Category Management as a service to the Telenor Business Units, taking full responsibility for the end-to-end Sourcing process and performance of global spend categories. Functioning as one Global Procurement team across all Telenor markets, we enable Telenor’s strategic ambitions by becoming a centre of expertise in the pursuit of efficient operations. TPC seeks qualified procurement professionals that are comfortable working in a global setup in the fast-paced Telecom field. About the Role As the Category Manager for CORE, Networks, you will be part of the TPC Networks Sourcing team and will report to the Director, Head of CORE Category. You will work closely with both corporate in Telenor and all of the Business Units. As the Category Manager you will be working closely with the Head of Category by contributing to the end to end Category management and strategy development, including sourcing execution, contract negotiation, as well as supplier management processes. Your role is pivotal in identifying and realizing cost saving initiatives that deliver real business value in the category across all of Telenor’s Business Units. Main tasks include: · Develop comprehensive understanding of the Networks category, contribute to end to end category strategy development and perform analysis to support category strategy work · Collaborate with user departments for preparing and executing the strategy, innovative analysis and proactively addressing procurement needs · Identify, lead and execute cost saving initiatives that deliver value in the procurement of goods and services for the company · Prepare and lead TCO analysis during procurement processes and participate in negotiations · Manage resources and stakeholders in a sourcing process · Actively work with the Global Procurement Teams from different Business as a part of extended Category Team · Implementation of category sourcing strategy and skilled approach to vendor management · Work together with the user Teams and responsible for Demand & Portfolio Management for the entire Category · Ensure compliance with policies, processes and achieve targets · Measures to review and assess progress, savings, and targets · Develop and prepare periodic reports on all procurement activities · Ensure contract management, implementation and follow-up activities · Evaluate and standardize contract requirements across Telenor Business Units; · Understand supply market and perform thorough supplier prequalification for the category · Maintain an awareness of latest buying techniques and theories and develop application within the company · Post contract management activities - Manage contracts and price book relevant to the category - Handle dispute with global suppliers Profile To be successful in this role you should be a seasoned professional eager to develop yourself in strategic sourcing. You should have an experience in strategic sourcing and contract management. The successful candidate should enjoy and be proficient in contract negotiations, networking and stakeholder management. Furthermore, the successful candidate must be result oriented, demonstrating excellent collaboration abilities and with confidence be able to communicate both internally and externally and continually build new relationships. Other attributes to enjoy this role will be: Strong business knowledge in telecommunications landscape Deep insight into end to end Sourcing process and strategies. Strong ability to communicate and interact effectively across organizational and cultural boundaries, internal and external Result oriented, demonstrating excellent collaboration abilities Able to work with a high degree of execution power and passion Understand the vendor market Strong analytical, systems thinking and problem solving capabilities Demonstrate commitment, maturity, flexibility and speed in response to business and challenges Possess Commercial and negotiation skills Highly creative and innovate mindset Knowledge of sourcing techniques and demand management & demand forecasting methods Familiar with contract setup activities such as specification definition, contract T&C setup High level of integrity and ethics Qualification and Experience Requirements · Bachelor degree in Technology, Finance or Business or equivalent. MBA will be preferred. · Minimum 5 years in a procurement / contract management / vendor management role preferably with experience in Networks area · Proficient in use of MS Excel, performing data analyses and co-relation using and processing tools, e.g. ThinkCell., Excel or Tableau to be Able to produce and draw conclusions based on the analysis

Job_Title: APAC Azure AI, Gaming & MR Product Marketing Manager
Job_Descriptions: Microsoft is on a mission to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. Our culture is centered on embracing a growth mindset, a theme of inspiring excellence, and encouraging teams and leaders to bring their best each day. In doing so, we create life-changing innovations that impact billions of lives around the world. You can help us to achieve our mission. The Azure business is a critical strategic monetization and growth lever for the company. This business consists of growing Azure consumption in both our customer base and acquiring new customers across both Microsoft and Open Source technologies. The Azure Artifical Intelligence, Gaming and Mixed Reality Product Marketing Manager (PMM) is responsible for leading the Azure Go-To-Market strategy in APAC to deliver customer & partner success, resulting in revenue, growth and share outcomes for their Azure aligned Priorities. The PMM must develop strong partnerships across marketing, partner, services and sales to lead and execute the priorities. Each Azure PMM leads the field business for their solution/motion and has overall responsibilities for enabling each Area teams’ success by: Lead the Azure business in alignment with other business owners; Empower Customers to Migrate & Innovate apps to the cloud and enable them to build skills and govern their cloud journey; Build and land growth plans to win and maximize the local market opportunity, based on the WW Azure priorities; Drive business outcomes by executing local Azure Go-To-Market plan to exceed business targets; Provide input on local integrated marketing plan development by providing business objectives to CMO IMMs; Build a comprehensive event plan, including locally required events, for the fiscal year to harmonize with CMO. The PMM is required to have a strong understanding of their solution area and or motion, specifically at the 200-300 level, and a deep understanding of customer solutions and strategies and end-to-end market ecosystem. This role represents the relevant Azure solutions, within the subsidiary and is the subject matter expert, and is the market facing spokesperson. In addition, they must be able to articulate the local competitive landscape and develop local compete strategies and product differentiation by leveraging corporate and local research, partner insights and customer feedback. Responsibilities Own and Land Your Propositions: Plan and execute activity that promotes Azure services to drive revenue growth; lead key product/services moments/activities/releases Maintain product knowledge and evangelize the product internally and externally to press, enthusiasts, influencers, sales (for pre-sales and consumption driving) customer and partner scenarios Act as the voice of the field by ensuring timely updates/feedback to corporate on Azure Priority execution and performance in Area/Subsidiary Orchestrate adoption and execution of relevant Azure specific sales plays to deliver ACR growth by leveraging MEI data, MSX- Content, and GearUp Go-to-Market Planning: Own the local product marketing strategy in accordance with growth and bridge models. Use corporate guidance to align Azure Priorities and Programs & Investments Orchestrate the creation of local Azure GTM plans and investment decisions. Lead targeting for local market-owned activities, partner with segment/channel teams to prioritize investment decisions for non-product-marketing owned activities. Develop competitive strategies to drive target market share gains. Respond to new market, product, strategy dynamics Drive inclusive marketing through the development of approachable, representative, accessible, and localized marketing strategies and tactics. Business Outcomes: Monitor and understand Azure priority performance; orchestrate execution to deliver on business metrics related to the Rhythm of Connections (ROC) and course correct the GTM plans with the business owners to deliver results. Actively lead and engage with all stakeholders across the subsidiary for One Microsoft orchestration across sales, partner, marketing, and service Determine key insights and asks to accelerate adoption of Azure services, qualify inhibitors (with recommendations) to escalate to subsidiary LT and corporate Best Practice identification and sharing across the Area/Subsidiaries and with corporate to exponentially sale successful performance. Qualifications Key Experiences, Skills, and Knowledge: 5-7 years related experience Evangelist and subject matter expert for product Deep customer focus and understanding Strong analytical skills Excellent communicator Track record of strong influencing and stakeholder management skills Education: Bachelor’s Degree (B.S./B.A.) preferred, MSC/MBA a plus, relevant fields of study include Marketing, Business, Computer Science and/or equivalent experience Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. Job_Descriptions: A Chef de Partie, Osteria Mozza prepares and cooks according to standard procedures, recipes, photographs and given instructions, assisting the Sous Chef in training team members. The role participates in product development and ensures the smooth operation of the kitchen. What will you be doing? As Chef de Partie, Osteria Mozza, you will be responsible for performing the following tasks to the highest standards: · Prepare food for guests efficiently, economically, and hygienically as per standard recipes and procedures. · Assist the Sous Chef in the day-to-day operation of the kitchen and to help maintain a high standard of food preparation and presentation. · Plan, prepare and implement high quality food and beverage products, and set-ups in all areas and in the restaurants. · Work seamlessly with recipes, standards and plating guides. · Maintain cleanliness and hygiene according to established standards. · Maintain all HACCP aspects within the hotel operation. · Use all equipment, tools and machines appropriately. · Work for off-site events when tasked. · Complete tasks and jobs outside of the kitchen area when requested. · Assist in inventory taking. · Knowledgeable of hotel’s occupancy, events, forecasts and achievements. · Prepare menus as requested. · Work closely with the Stewarding department to ensure high levels of cleanliness and low levels of lost and breakages. · Effectively respond to every guests’ requests. · Learn and adapt to changes. · Maintain at all times a professional and positive attitude towards team members and supervisors. · Adhere to established hotel rules and team member handbook, ensuring all team members under your supervision do so as well for the department to operate smoothly. · Coordinate, organize and participate in all production pertaining to the kitchen. · Check and follow-up on the ingredients for the ala carte menus, daily menus, and seasonal specials, maintaining the standards of pre-set recipes, portion control and costing at all times. · Monitor food quality and quantity to ensure the most economical usage of ingredients. · Check that the quality of food prepared by team members meet the required standard and make the necessary adjustments. · Monitor overall food operation and ensure that food items are being prepared in a timely and correct manner. · Understand, practice and promote teamwork to achieve missions, goals, and overall departmental standards. · The Management reserves the right to make changes to this job description at its sole discretion and without advance notice. · Carry out any other reasonable duties and responsibilities as assigned. What are we looking for? A Chef de Partie, Osteria Mozza serving Hilton Brands is always working on behalf of our Guests and working with other Team Members. To successfully fill this role, you should maintain the attitude, behaviours, skills, and values that follow: · High school graduate or similar qualification in Culinary. · At least 3 years working experience in a 5-star category hotel or individual restaurant with high standards. · Possess a valid Food Hygiene certificate. · Must have a variety of seafood and meat processing techniques. · Proficient with a variety of steaming, baking and braising, grilling cooking techniques. · Familiar with a variety of cooked food processing, storing and receiving standards. (For Main Kitchen) · Able to work with all products and ingredients. · Able to set priorities and complete tasks in a timely manner. · Work well in stressful situations, remain calm under pressure and able to solve problems. · Able to work in a moist, hot and sometimes loud environment. · Possess good leadership and training skills. · Knowledgeable in HACCP. · Working experience in similar capacity with international chain hotels is preferred. · Good command in verbal and written English to meet business needs, preferred. What will it be like to work for Hilton? Hilton is the leading global hospitality company, spanning the lodging sector from luxurious full-service hotels and resorts to extended-stay suites and mid-priced hotels. For nearly a century, Hilton has offered business and leisure travelers the finest in accommodations, service, amenities and value. Hilton is dedicated to continuing its tradition of providing exceptional guest experiences across its global brands. Our vision to fill the earth with the light and warmth of hospitality unites us as a team to create remarkable hospitality experiences around the world every day. And, our amazing Team Members are at the heart of it all!

Careers That Change Lives Medtronic Singapore Operations was among the first international medical technology firms to set up manufacturing operations in Singapore. We are one of the most advanced medical device manufacturing sites and the first manufacturing facility of its kind in the region to make implantable cardiac leads, pacemakers and monitors. Our Purpose Founded in 1949, our Mission continues to serve as our ethical framework and inspirational goal for our employees around the world. It guides our day-to-day work and reminds us that our efforts are transforming the lives of millions of people each year. If you have a passion for medical device manufacturing, this opportunity could be for you! Test Technician (Electrical) A Day in the Life Support the investigation and analyzing of Non-Conformance material and products. Support and maintain the database of equipment, tooling, jig, fixture for the production needs. Creation of tooling/jig/equipment database to support the new/legacy product transfer. Support Qualification/Validation for product/process according to the schedule. Support process improvement and participate in Engineering Development/Transfer activities. Develops and implements applicable state of the art manufacturing systems and technology solutions to optimize manufacturing quality, improve efficiency and reduce cost. Key Responsibilities: Provide analysis of in-process Product Review Board and investigation of Non-Conformity/Defects. Provide technical solutions, review and implementation to resolve production issues. Determine the acceptance criteria for In-process rejects and perform verification. Develop Work Instruction to support the manufacturing function. Collaborates with the Manufacturing Engineer and Operation to evaluate, install, characterize, qualify and validate product/process/line in assigned scope of processes. Collaborates with Product Transfer Engineer to evaluate, characterize, qualify and validate major manufacturing and product improvements within the performance objectives. Trains operators and technical support of Implantable products within IQ/OQ/PQ activities. Supports Implantable Leads/Devices tasks (technical support, non-conformity management, continuous improvements. Supports Operation Excellence Initiatives Must Have: Minimum Requirements NTC2 in Engineering or Higher Minimum of 2 years of relevant experience and may require vocational or technical education or certification in addition to prior work experience Nice to Have Relevant experience in process or product failure/defect analysis, troubleshooting of equipment installation and maintenance in a manufacturing environment. Strong practical knowledge of mechanical or electrical/electronics in the area of applications and implementation. Experience in the application of the protocols of validation and/or tests of validation produced. Experience in leading technical project improvement to reduce manufacturing waste/cost avoidance. Preferably with experience in handling nonconforming products. Knowledge of Lean Manufacturing principles. Knowledge of ISO13485 and/or Good Manufacturing Practice (GMP). Familiar with MS Office tools and Statistical Process Control (SPC) tools. About Medtronic Together, we can change healthcare worldwide. At Medtronic, we push the limits of what technology, therapies and services can do to help alleviate pain, restore health and extend life. We challenge ourselves and each other to make tomorrow better than yesterday. It is what makes this an exciting and rewarding place to be. We want to accelerate and advance our ability to create meaningful innovations - but we will only succeed with the right people on our team. Let’s work together to address universal healthcare needs and improve patients’ lives. Help us shape the future.
