Telenor Group is a leading telecommunications company across the Nordics and Asia with 188 million customers. We are committed to responsible business conduct and driven by the ambition of empowering societies. Connectivity has been Telenor’s domain for more than 160 years, and our purpose is to connect our customers to what matters most. We have a leading Nordic position in mobile, broadband and TV services, as well as substantial activities in subsidiaries and joint venture operations, including mobile financial services and online classifieds in the Asia region. Worldwide, Telenor Group and our operations’ teams are 16,000 people strong. Telenor Procurement Company (TPC), established in 2017 and headquartered in Singapore, operates as a subsidiary of the Telenor Group. We deliver Global Category Management as a service to the Telenor Business Units, taking full responsibility for the end-to-end Sourcing process and performance of global spend categories. Functioning as one Global Procurement team across all Telenor markets, we enable Telenor’s strategic ambitions by becoming a centre of expertise in the pursuit of efficient operations. TPC seeks qualified procurement professionals that are comfortable working in a global setup in the fast-paced Telecom field. About the Role As the Category Manager for RAN, Networks, [ML1] you will be part of the TPC Networks Sourcing team and will report to the Director, Head of RAN Category. You will work closely with both corporate in Telenor and all of the Business Units. As the RAN SCM you will be working closely with the entire RAN category team by deeply understand the company vision, goals and objectives with a holistic strategy development, including sourcing execution, contract negotiation, as well as supplier management processes. Your role is pivotal in identifying and analyzing in overall RAN commercial aspect including cost saving initiatives and contract improvement, negotiating with the strategic supplier that deliver real business value in the category across all of Telenor’s Business Units and Customer. Main tasks include: · Contracting especially in commercial principle/cost model related (research, reading/interpreting, drafting/redlining, working with legal) · Negotiations (driving stakeholder alignment, delivering/exchange of offers, reading/creating leverage points, creating Issues Lists, escalation) · Collaborate with team member and other user departments for preparing and executing the strategy, innovative analysis and proactively addressing procurement needs · Manage, lead and Support Category into Company business’s topic in Procurement As A Services (PaaS) that deliver value in the procurement of goods and services for the company · Understand supply market and perform thorough commercial model strategies for the category · Maintain an awareness of latest commercial and negotiation techniques and theories and develop application within the company To enjoy this role and succeed in it you would need to be/have: Strong business knowledge in telecommunications landscape Deep insight into end to end Sourcing process and strategies. Strong ability to communicate and interact effectively across organizational and cultural boundaries, internal and external Result oriented, demonstrating excellent collaboration abilities Able to work with a high degree of execution power and passions Understand the vendor market Strong analytical, systems thinking and problem solving capabilities Demonstrate commitment, maturity, flexibility and speed in response to business and challenges Possess Commercial (Contract Commercial T&Cs) and negotiation skills Highly creative and innovate mindset Knowledge of sourcing techniques and demand management & demand forecasting methods Strong written/verbal communication skills including synthesis of complex ideas, proactively addressing needs/questions and ability to influence via persuasive communication Familiar with contract setup activities such as specification definition, contract T&C setup High level of integrity and ethics Qualification and Experience Requirements · Bachelor degree in Technology, Finance or Business or equivalent. MBA will be preferred. · Minimum 5 years in a procurement / contract management / vendor management role preferably with experience in Telecommunication Networks area · Proficient in use of MS Excel, performing data analyses and co-relation using and processing tools, e.g. ThinkCell., Excel or Tableau to be Able to produce and draw conclusions based on the analysis

Telenor Group is a leading telecommunications company across the Nordics and Asia with 188 million customers. We are committed to responsible business conduct and driven by the ambition of empowering societies. Connectivity has been Telenor’s domain for more than 160 years, and our purpose is to connect our customers to what matters most. We have a leading Nordic position in mobile, broadband and TV services, as well as substantial activities in subsidiaries and joint venture operations, including mobile financial services and online classifieds in the Asia region. Worldwide, Telenor Group and our operations’ teams are 16,000 people strong. Telenor Procurement Company (TPC), established in 2017 and headquartered in Singapore, operates as a subsidiary of the Telenor Group. We deliver Global Category Management as a service to the Telenor Business Units, taking full responsibility for the end-to-end Sourcing process and performance of global spend categories. Functioning as one Global Procurement team across all Telenor markets, we enable Telenor’s strategic ambitions by becoming a centre of expertise in the pursuit of efficient operations. TPC seeks qualified procurement professionals that are comfortable working in a global setup in the fast-paced Telecom field. About the Role As the Category Specialist, you will be part of the TPC ISIT Sourcing team and will report to the Head of category/category director. You will work closely with Telenor Group functions and all of the Telenor Business Units. The objective of this position is to perform analyses to support category strategy, demand management, managing the category target & use benchmarking tools actively to ensure category and business performance. Your role is pivotal in identifying and realizing cost saving initiatives that deliver real business value in the category across all of Telenor’s Business Units. Main tasks Contribute to E2E Category strategy development Perform analysis to support category strategy work Collaborate with user departments for preparing and executing the strategy, innovative analysis and proactively addressing procurement needs Identify, lead and execute cost saving initiatives that deliver value in the procurement of goods and services for the company Manage resources and stakeholders in a sourcing process Prepare and lead TCO analysis during procurement processes and participate in negotiations Implementation of category sourcing strategy and skilled approach to vendor management Ensure contract management, implementation and follow-up activities Understand supply market and perform thorough supplier prequalification for respective category Maintain an awareness of latest buying techniques and theories and develop application within the company Sourcing Execution for Global Framework Agreements Post contract management activities Manage contracts and price book relevant to the category Handle dispute with global suppliers & stakeholder To enjoy this role and succeed in it you would need to be/have: Strong business knowledge in telecommunications landscape Deep insight into end to end Sourcing process and strategies. Strong ability to communicate and interact effectively across organizational and cultural boundaries, internal and external Result oriented, demonstrating excellent collaboration abilities Able to work with a high degree of execution power and passion Understand the vendor market Strong analytical, systems thinking and problem solving capabilities Demonstrate commitment, maturity, flexibility and speed in response to business and challenges Possess Commercial and negotiation skills Highly creative and innovate mindset Knowledge of sourcing techniques and demand management & demand forecasting methods Familiar with contract setup activities such as specification definition, contract T&C setup High level of integrity and ethics Qualification and Experience Requirements · Bachelor degree in Technology, Finance or Business or equivalent. · Minimum 2 years in a procurement / contract management / vendor management role preferably with experience in IT area · Proficient in use of MS Excel, performing data analyses and co-relation using and processing tools, e.g. ThinkCell., Excel or Tableau to be Able to produce and draw conclusions based on the analysis · ITIL and/or SAM certifications preferred

Hiring_Company: SUMITOMO MITSUI BANKING CORPORATION SINGAPORE BRANCH
Job_Title: Director  – ESG Solutions, Corporate Banking APAC
Job_Descriptions: SMBC is a leading global bank with strong corporate banking and investment banking capability in Asia. Headquartered in Tokyo, Japan, SMBC has a global reach with operations in over 45 countries with over 60,000 employees across the financial group. Embodying entrepreneurship sprit, SMBC delivers holistic financial solutions to our clients including innovative products and tailored advise. We are driven by our 5 core values i.e. Integrity, Customer First, Proactive and Innovative, Speed & Quality and Team SMBC Group. While SMBC has historically been an active player in corporate financing in Asia we are increasing our focus on sustainable finance with corporate and institutional clients. With our Green x Globe 2030 strategy we aim to ‘create the future of the earth and humanity with our customers’ by addressing and managing environmental and social issues and by accelerating the sustainability agenda via sustainable finance. To support this strategy, we are looking for a corporate banker to support the Head of ESG Solutions in driving this initiative in Asia Pacific. The role will support the ESG Solutions function across Asia Pacific Division (ASEAN, South Asia, Australia) with a strong focus on sustainable finance. Roles & Responsibilities The candidate will drive sustainable finance business development efforts targeting our clients in Asia Pacific. Key roles will include: 1. Collaborate with coverage and product teams in developing credible sustainable finance transactions, from origination to execution of sustainable finance transactions 2. Coordinate internal governance and monitoring system to ensure the quality of the Banks’s sustainable finance transactions 3. Leverage your knowledge of sustainable finance to enable you to act as Trusted Advisor for client stakeholders 4. Be at the forefront of the sustainable finance market and standard developments and share those knowledge and insights with clients and internal stakeholders (senior management, coverage teams, product teams, risk teams) 5. Support the review of existing loan portfolios and develop transitioning strategy 6. Connect with local and regional sustainable finance communities (working groups, regulators) and participate in engagements linked to sustainable finance Requirements 1. Over 8 years of experience in corporate/ investment banking with 3 years direct experience in sustainable finance transactions 2. Experience of an equivalent role at a major global investment or corporate bank 3. Strong understanding and knowledge of sustainable finance market developments and opportunities 4. Outstanding written and verbal communication skills. Ability to communicate with senior management in a clear and structured manner. 5. Self-motivated and strong interpersonal skills

Job_Title: Senior Manager, Group Risk Management ( Risk Strategy & Assurance)
Job_Descriptions: The Risk Strategy & Assurance pillar is mandated to assist Singtel in accomplishing its business objectives by adopting a systematic and disciplined approach to Risk & assurance programs. The role ensures that there is an effective and efficient framework in place to give sufficient, continuous, and reliable assurance on organisational stewardship and objectives. Responsibilities The role is expected to work in a team or independently on the following: Support the roll-out and implementation of control framework including assurance mapping exercise. Provide structured mapping of assurances and understanding the sources of assurance and their scope Clarify, rationalise, and consolidate multiple assurance inputs, providing greater oversight of assurance activities for the Senior Management in line with risk appetite. Provide assurance that significant inherent risks are being managed to an acceptable level within the Organization’s risk appetite. Promote a risk and control awareness culture through awareness programme (communications, workshops, training, dialogues, etc.) and sharing of past learnings Support ad-hoc projects such as Partnering with stakeholders on special projects to ensure consistency in applying Risk & assurance methodology and support the strengthening and improvement of processes. Requirements At least 6-8 years of risk management, consulting, auditing or IT project management work experience Experience in working in challenging business environment with proven capabilities in organizing, summarizing and presenting complex information Experience in reviewing commercial contracts and good understanding of the legality of contract terms Advanced knowledge of risk management and control concepts, leading risk management practices and standards (e.g. ISO 31000, COSO) Good engagement skills. Good communication (oral, written) and presentation skills and proven track record in interacting with all levels of management Strong analytical and critical thinking skills - independent and objective In-depth understanding of the telecommunications / ICT and digital industry and the risks faced by the Singtel Group and its businesses. These include the technology risks, competition and transformation developments in the telecommunications / ICT/ digital industry, environmental risks, regulatory risks, cyber security risks, etc. We are committed to a safe and healthy environment for our employees & customers and will require all prospective employees to be fully vaccinated.

KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES: The successful candidate is a seasoned fundamental investor with extensive experience analysing and investing in companies. The successful candidate will join a small, cohesive, and high-performing India growth Equity focus team that is part of a larger Growth Equities team. The candidate must demonstrate a strong fit with the team, with the ability to embrace the team's investment process. This is an important role with a number of key responsibilities, including: Conduct in-depth analysis of potential investment candidates. This will include gaining a detailed understanding of the drivers of returns and valuations for the business in question and financial analysis based on detailed financial modelling. Present company and industry analysis to the team, and clearly articulate and debate the key drivers of the business and valuation. Actively engage in debates and discussions of stock and portfolio ideas from other team members. Contribute to portfolio construction and stock position discussions. Working with members of other focus teams to leverage expertise and work across the equity platform. Support the marketing effort as necessary. EXPERIENCE / QUALIFICATIONS: A passion for equity analysis. A critical thinker. Open to challenge and debate. A strong team player with a sense of loyalty and commitment to quality. Ability to work well in a small, cohesive team. Articulate, with an ability to communicate effectively with all stakeholders. Trustworthy, ethical and open in all dealings. Resourceful and flexible, able to respond in a rapidly changing environment. Good fit with cultural values of Eastspring. Around 4-6 years’ experience as an India equity analyst with a demonstrable level of achievement Strong and appropriate academic qualifications. CFA Charter holder would be an advantage.

Job Description Define baseline security standards for cloud security which includes AWS, Azure, GCP and Kubernetes. Drive Sprinklr’s Secure Software Development Lifecycle with a focus on infrastructure and cloud security. Help proactively assess security risk through infrastructure deep dives, threat modeling, requirements, design, architecture and implementation reviews. Partner with Engineering/R&D, DevOps, peers and security champions on all things cloud security. Review architecture, vulnerabilities, deployments, misconfigurations, tool findings etc for FedRAMP cloud environments. Understand, research and internalize external cloud vulnerabilities, misconfigurations and security trends. Identify opportunities for security tooling and automation with a goal of translating the security standards into policy as code. Ideate, prototype and experiment with tools with a goal to scale Sprinklr’s cloud first architecture. Help improve security tooling, processes and how product teams approach deployment in their day to day work. Be a security advocate and subject matter expert within the organization and be able to effectively communicate security risk and concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences. Collaborate closely with the Security, Legal, and R&D/Engineering teams to create a committed roadmap for security fixes and enhancements. Roll up your sleeves in urgent or reactive situations. Job Requirements Skills & Qualifications: 8 to 10 years of experience in infrastructure security OR experience in devops or as an architect in large-scale, distributed software projects, preferably with cloud service providers (SaaS, IaaS, PaaS) Have sound security concepts with proficiency in public cloud security, networking, host security, shared responsibility model. Deep understanding of security controls for modern architecture, especially AWS, Azure, GCP, and Kubernetes-based delivery platforms Comprehensive experience in selecting, operating, and rationalizing security tooling for common security processes, including CSPMs, vulnerability scanners, etc. Proficient in one or more programming languages (such as Go, Python, javascript, java, etc ) Experience in threat modeling, security code reviews with an eye to identify security flaws. Experience triaging, identifying and prioritizing security risk with a clear understanding of its impact to an organization. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Be a continuous learner and have the knack to learn new technologies, trends and concepts. Good To Have: A degree (Bachelors, Master, PhD) in Computer Science, Security or a related discipline. Experience with CI/CD pipelines and supply chain security. Basic knowledge of GitOps, infrastructure as code (IaC) and IaC scanning tools. Experience with SQL and/or working with data platforms such as Snowflake will be an added plus. Experience in AWS and Azure GovClouds.

Job_Title: Customer Engineer, Application Modernization, Public Sector, Google Cloud - Singapore
Job_Descriptions: The area: Google Cloud Google Cloud accelerates organizations’ ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology – all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems. The role: Customer Engineer, Application Modernization, Public Sector, Google Cloud - Singapore The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and build what's next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. Our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will play a key role in understanding the needs of our customers and help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners. Additional Role Description: In this role, you will engage with customers to understand their business and technical requirements, and persuasively present practical and useful solutions on Google Cloud. You will work with technical Sales teams as an enterprise hybrid cloud subject matter expert to differentiate and paint the vision of Google Cloud to our customers. You will help prospective customers and partners understand the power of Google Cloud, explaining technical features, helping customers design architectures, engage in proof of concepts, and troubleshooting potential roadblocks. Responsibilities: - Work with the team to identify and qualify business opportunities, understand key customer technical objections and develop a strategy to resolve technical blockers. - Provide in-depth enterprise infrastructure/cloud modernization expertise to support the technical relationship with Google’s customers, including product and solution briefings, proof-of-concept work, and partner directly with product management to prioritize solutions impacting customer adoption to Google Cloud. - Guide customers through assessments of their existing legacy application environment(s), provide recommendations on a prioritization roadmap for application modernization, identify candidate applications for migration to hybrid-cloud computing models. - Structure and execute prototyping workshops to prove out proposed new architectures, developing best practices, and documenting key blocking requirements for prioritization with engineering. - Travel to customer sites, conferences, and other related events as required. Minimum qualifications: - 5 years of experience as a sales engineer in cloud environments or equivalent experience in a customer-facing role - Presentation experience, including experience delivering technical pitches. Preferred qualifications: - Master's degree in Computer Science or other technical field. - Regional experience in role in Asia Pacific region for technical sales or professional consulting experience in the Singapore Public Sector, Healthcare, or Education market. - Practical experience with legacy and modern application development, cloud service delivery, and deployment. - Practical experience with containers and associated technologies including Docker, Kubernetes, Istio, Serverless, and Microservices. - Practical experience with converged infrastructure and virtualization systems including Nutanix, VMWare, Cisco UCS, and KVM. - Experience with cloud-native software development methodologies and tools to support application development/deployment stages including CI/CD (i.e. Jenkins, Spinnaker, Concourse)

About Us We are an entrepreneurial integrated communications agency that has gone from start-up to multi-national in just 22 years. We have grown every year since foundation due to a combination of organic growth and strategic acquisitions. Our ambition is to break into the top ten by 2020. We have a network of 25 offices, 550 employees and revenue of $64m. Not bad for an agency that doesn’t take itself too seriously. What’s behind our success? Well, we’re independent so we can continually reinvest the majority of our profits in the company to propel development. We invest wisely in growth areas such as our social, digital and content teams. We challenge ourselves to stay one step ahead of the competition by delivering innovative solutions for clients which can be activated at pace and scale. Hiring_Company: SUMITOMO MITSUI BANKING CORPORATION SINGAPORE BRANCH
Job_Title: Executive Director  – ESG Solutions, Corporate Banking APAC
Job_Descriptions: SMBC is a leading global bank with strong corporate banking and investment banking capability in Asia. Headquartered in Tokyo, Japan, SMBC has a global reach with operations in over 45 countries with over 60,000 employees across the financial group. Embodying entrepreneurship sprit, SMBC delivers holistic financial solutions to our clients including innovative products and tailored advise. We are driven by our 5 core values i.e. Integrity, Customer First, Proactive and Innovative, Speed & Quality and Team SMBC Group. While SMBC has historically been an active player in corporate financing in Asia we are increasing our focus on sustainable finance with corporate and institutional clients. With our Green x Globe 2030 strategy we aim to ‘create the future of the earth and humanity with our customers’ by addressing and managing environmental and social issues and by accelerating the sustainability agenda via sustainable finance. To support this strategy, we are looking for a corporate banker to support the Head of ESG Solutions in driving this initiative in Asia Pacific. The role will support the ESG Solutions function across Asia Pacific Division (ASEAN, South Asia, Australia) with a strong focus on sustainable finance. Roles & Responsibilities The candidate will drive sustainable finance business development efforts targeting our clients in Asia Pacific. Key roles will include: 1. Collaborate with coverage and product teams in developing credible sustainable finance transactions, from origination to execution of sustainable finance transactions 2. Coordinate internal governance and monitoring system to ensure the quality of the Banks’s sustainable finance transactions 3. Leverage your knowledge of sustainable finance to enable you to act as Trusted Advisor for client stakeholders 4. Be at the forefront of the sustainable finance market and standard developments and share those knowledge and insights with clients and internal stakeholders (senior management, coverage teams, product teams, risk teams) 5. Support the review of existing loan portfolios and develop transitioning strategy 6. Connect with local and regional sustainable finance communities (working groups, regulators) and participate in engagements linked to sustainable finance Requirements 1. Over 8 years of experience in corporate/ investment banking with 3 years direct experience in sustainable finance transactions 2. Experience of an equivalent role at a major global investment or corporate bank 3. Strong understanding and knowledge of sustainable finance market developments and opportunities 4. Outstanding written and verbal communication skills. Ability to communicate with senior management in a clear and structured manner. 5. Self-motivated and strong interpersonal skills

Batching Plant Management • Coordinate with Production Team with relevant parties to obtain detail production schedules to plan the quantity of materials for production. • Determined Precast Moulds requirements with the Production Team in terms of quantity and prepare concrete according to the volume of works and limit wastages. • Schedule & monitor materials delivery and consumption. • Establish Precast Components production schedule to tie in with projects requirements. • Assist the Production Team to carry out trial mix design for all projects well in advance to meet the start of production. The production team have to seek approval on the mix design with the 28th day strength to the project QP before can commence to use the propose mix design for the project. • Ensure the quality of sand, aggregates and other materials meet tender specification. • Ensure the quality control for the batching of concrete all the time. • Keep proper records of inspection, testing of materials and cube strength and calibration certificates. • Manage the batching plant and arrange for the maintenance and repair of the plant. • Ensure concrete batch are mix according to the approved mix design. • Keep proper records of batching plant computer system with the master computer system. A separate file to keep computer print outs and record book to update the field works. • Manage concrete delivering system and ensure all waste material are managed as per the approved system in Singapore with relevant authorities. • Ensure the delivery order for material suppliers. Weight vehicle transporting incoming or outgoing materials and issuance of bridge ticket on the delivery order. Telenor Group is a leading telecommunications company across the Nordics and Asia with 188 million customers. We are committed to responsible business conduct and driven by the ambition of empowering societies. Connectivity has been Telenor’s domain for more than 160 years, and our purpose is to connect our customers to what matters most. We have a leading Nordic position in mobile, broadband and TV services, as well as substantial activities in subsidiaries and joint venture operations, including mobile financial services and online classifieds in the Asia region. Worldwide, Telenor Group and our operations’ teams are 16,000 people strong. Telenor Procurement Company (TPC), established in 2017 and headquartered in Singapore, operates as a subsidiary of the Telenor Group. We deliver Global Category Management as a service to the Telenor Business Units, taking full responsibility for the end-to-end Sourcing process and performance of global spend categories. Functioning as one Global Procurement team across all Telenor markets, we enable Telenor’s strategic ambitions by becoming a centre of expertise in the pursuit of efficient operations. TPC seeks qualified procurement professionals that are comfortable working in a global setup in the fast-paced Telecom field. About the Role As the Category Manager you will be part of the TPC ISIT category team and will report to the Director, Head of category. You will work closely with both corporate in Telenor and all of the Business Units. As the Category Manager you will be working closely with the Head of Category by contributing to the end to end Category management and strategy development, including sourcing execution, contract negotiation, as well as supplier management processes. Your role is pivotal in identifying and realizing cost saving initiatives that deliver real business value in the category across all of Telenor’s Business Units. Main tasks include: · Develop comprehensive understanding of the ISIT category, contribute to end to end category strategy development and perform analysis to support category strategy work · Collaborate with user departments for preparing and executing the strategy, innovative analysis and proactively addressing procurement needs · Identify, lead and execute cost saving initiatives that deliver value in the procurement of goods and services for the company · Prepare and lead TCO analysis during procurement processes and participate in negotiations · Manage resources and stakeholders in a sourcing process · Implementation of category sourcing strategy and skilled approach to vendor management · Ensure compliance with policies, processes and achieve targets · Measures to review and assess progress, savings, and targets · Develop and prepare periodic reports on all procurement activities · Ensure contract management, implementation and follow-up activities · Understand supply market and perform thorough supplier prequalification for the category · Maintain an awareness of latest buying techniques and theories and develop application within the company · Post contract management activities - Manage contracts and price book relevant to the category - Handle dispute with global suppliers To enjoy this role and succeed in it you would need to be/have: Strong business knowledge in telecommunications landscape Deep insight into end to end Sourcing process and strategies Strong ability to communicate and interact effectively across organizational and cultural boundaries, internal and external Result oriented, demonstrating excellent collaboration abilities Able to work with a high degree of execution power and passion Understand the vendor market Strong analytical, systems thinking and problem solving capabilities Demonstrate commitment, maturity, flexibility and speed in response to business and challenges Possess Commercial and negotiation skills Highly creative and innovate mindset Knowledge of sourcing techniques and demand management & demand forecasting methods Familiar with contract setup activities such as specification definition, contract T&C setup High level of integrity and ethics Qualification and Experience Requirements · Bachelor degree in Technology, Finance or Business or equivalent. MBA will be preferred. · Minimum 5 years in a procurement / contract management / vendor management role preferably with experience in IT area · Proficient in use of MS Excel, performing data analyses and co-relation using and processing tools, e.g. ThinkCell., Excel or Tableau to be Able to produce and draw conclusions based on the analysis

Roles & Responsibilities: 1.1 The Control centre operation is organized into teams on shifts to man System Control Centre for 7 days a week and 24 hours a day, inclusive of Sundays and Public Holidays. 1.2 The Control centre is jointly manned with customers and our team. 1.3 The following management is required to ensure the System is running and have high availability: 1.3.1 Fault management a. To monitor any fault alarm generated from the Network Management System (NMS); b. To identify the nature and type of the network failures whenever a fault alarm is generated or a fault is reported, and to execute the appropriate corrective actions to ensure minimum disruption to the network; c. To report the fault to the Maintenance Agency (MA) when the fault cannot be resolved at the SYSCON level; d. To liaise with MA and track the progress and report to customer when fault is resolved. 1.3.2 Configuration Management a. To maintain an up-to-date physical and logical configuration of the sub-systems with proper and accurate documentation; b. To maintain and manage the numbering plan for all SYSTEM end-user terminals; c. To perform network and new services configuration; d. To track and report to the customer any unauthorised equipment, hardware, applications, relocation, and etc. with regard to the overall configuration of the SYSTEM. 1.3.3 Performance Management a. To collect and compile network statistics periodically, and to analyse the statistics collected. The network performance results together with recommended solution to improve network performance, if required, are to be provided to the Customer; b. To track the performance in terms of the Reliability, Availability and Maintainability (RAM) of the various sub-systems with MA. Such task includes tracking the response time and turnaround time of the MA upon activated; c. To recommend to the Customer necessary actions to be taken to enhance the performance of the sub-systems; d. To assess and decide on the need to fine-tune the sub-systems based on the performance results submitted, and recommend technical solutions to the Customer. 1.3.4 Security Management a. To ensure that all components of the sub-systems located at the System Control Centre (NMTs, equipment of all sub-systems, equipment rooms, etc.) are physically secured according to the security guidelines set out by the Customer; b. To monitor the sub-systems against any unauthorised network access and to track down for such unauthorised access to the network. c. To desensitise SYSTEM terminal equipment; d. To reload terminal software; e. To monitor the overall security of the SYSTEM and to report any possible breach to the Customer; f. To recommend to the Customer the necessary actions to be taken against any unauthorised network access; To assist the Customer in safeguarding and restricting access to all the security related information. 1.3.5 General Support Management a. To advise and support the Customer in the planning and execution of special operations that involves allocation, configuration and deployment of SYSTEM resources. b. To formulate network recovery procedures in response to all possible failure scenarios for approval by the Customer. Such failure scenarios include example like network degradation on fallback modes and the total failure of the main System Control Centre site which necessitates the need to relocate operations to the alternate site. The network recovery procedures when approved by the Customer shall be constantly improved, updated and re-approved through the conduct of periodical exercises and validations; c. To assist the Customer in carrying out retrieval of logs; d. Support the Customer on site and monitor the network performances during major events; Requirements: 1. Only Singapore citizens that is security cleared (CAT2A) 2. Able to work in rotating shift (day and night) 3. Able to work in a team and with external stakeholders 4. Able to work under stress environment during outage or emergency 5. Experienced in control centre will be a plus and experienced will be considered for senior position or manager role 6. Knowledge in any domains/software is a must: - Data centre operation – Splunks, Solarwinds, operational process, setting up, SOP, BCP SOP - Security - Cisco, VPN, Symantec, RSA, CA, Palo Alto, familiar with IM8, ISM, CISSP - Systems - VMware, Nutannix, MS AD, MS servers, backup, Hyper V - Networking – L2 & L3 switches, networking design, CCNA min, CCNP is a plus

Microsoft's Business Applications Domain helps customers maximize their investment in Microsoft Dynamics solutions and the full portfolio of Microsoft Products through accelerated adoption and productive use of technologies. The Microsoft Business Applications Global Practice is part of a global organization of exceptional people who lead and serve our customers and partners as they realize their full potential through software and services.Microsoft's Business Applications Domain helps customers maximize their investment in Microsoft Dynamics solutions and the full portfolio of Microsoft Products through accelerated adoption and productive use of technologies. The Microsoft Business Applications Global Practice is part of a global organization of exceptional people who lead and serve our customers and partners as they realize their full potential through software and services. Responsibilities The Project Manager in the Asia Business Applications Delivery supports the Delivery Manager and takes responsibility for project delivery and execution on one or more of Microsoft's Dynamics projects at our customers. The role requires deep project management experience in a consulting organization, broad technology knowledge, and the ability to facilitate the successful deployment of a complex CE & F&O solution across multiple business teams within an organization. The Project Manager will help identify, pursue, and close strategic business development opportunities while continually driving add-on business within existing accounts. To accomplish this, the Project Manager must be effective in fostering executive level relationships. The successful candidate will help translate business needs into technology solutions which will be formulated in contracts and/or statements of work (SOW). The Project Manager is a key enabler for the success of an engagement, orchestrating Microsoft consultants, offshore resources, and partner staff. They manage the complete lifecycle of large and complex projects and have a passion for customers that is demonstrated through professionalism and striving for excellence in all aspects of the customer experience. The Project Manager is a leader; they will walk the halls, understand what's happening, and lead their team, the customer, and the project's delivery partners. They must have a good grasp of the basics of project management, and the personality and experience to be the go-to person for the project. The Project Manager must understand the needs of the customer (Statement of Work, Conditions of Satisfaction), Microsoft (needs of all internal stakeholders), and the vision of Microsoft Delivery and Microsoft Business Applications Solutions and be able to steer a path to meet the needs of all. Qualifications PMI PMP Certified Project Manager desirable Successfully delivered 5+ ERP and/or CRM for enterprise class customers Excellent communications (up / down / peers) Experience in supporting contractual & commercial management and execution Executive relationship management Proven track level in business domain & technical conversation Experienced in day to day project management including staffing, milestones, cost management, and deliverables. The Role The Technical Support Engineer serves as a champion for Pico’s customers. In pursuit of that goal, the Technical Support Engineer will partner with our customers to place emphasis on issue prevention rather than resolution. The Technical Support Engineer handles direct technical customer inquiries, performs complex root cause analysis duties and maintains customer satisfaction from a technical and professional level. This is a very dynamic and technically challenging role where you will be providing escalation support, interfacing with engineering on deep product issues, contributing to ongoing projects revolving around support tools, knowledge management, self-service initiatives and more. About the Role: Production Services is a customer facing group engaged with our customer development and production teams to ensure customer success with implementing Redline products. The Production Services team operates a 24x7 “Follow-the-Sun” support model using the teams in APAC, EMEA and AMRS You will be responsible for providing a high level of support and the onboarding of our customer base across equities, options, futures and foreign exchange markets, as well as working closely with our Engineering team to improve the software. You will be configuring Linux systems, diagnosing hardware and software faults and solving technical and applications problems. The role would suit an analytical thinking, motivated individual with a positive attitude, who has excellent written and verbal communication skills and strong computer skills. The successful candidate will be enthusiastic and prides themselves on attention to detail. Key Responsibilities: Building and developing relationships with clients whilst providing excellent technical support, deployment and change control process. Proactively monitor and manage business-critical real-time infrastructure systems, identifying issues and potential problem areas. Manage OS Patching and Application updates. Work with the engineering team on operational acceptance testing for new environments, while being able to analyse gaps in procedures and documentation. Replicate customer issues and verify fixes for customer patches and releases. Work continuously on a task until completion (or escalate to Engineering if required). Collaborate with team members to improve tools, systems, procedures and deliver project work.

Job_Title: Associate, Strategic Projects, BlackRock Platform Innovation
Job_Descriptions: About BlackRock BlackRock’s purpose is to help more and more people experience financial well-being. We are dedicated to helping our clients, employees, shareholders and communities achieve financial security, financial mobility, and financial freedom. BlackRock is trusted to manage more money than any other investment manager in the world, helping millions of people and the world’s biggest institutions and governments reach their investing goals. Our promise to our clients is to deliver products and services that provide clarity on the financial markets to help influence better investments decisions. To help employees stay energized, engaged and inspired, we offer a wide range of benefits including a strong retirement plan, tuition reimbursement, comprehensive healthcare, support for working parents and Flexible Time Off (FTO). Job Purpose / Background As a member of the BlackRock Platform Innovation (BPI) team, you will work on some of the firm’s most strategic, complex, and highly-valued projects. Our mission is to make the firm better by successfully shaping and delivering on the firm’s most strategic priorities, developing the versatility of our talent and exporting our project management delivery skillset together with a broad and deep knowledge of the firm. We act as the “connective tissue” between the various lines of business by applying in-depth knowledge of BlackRock’s organization, processes, and technology in order to inspire change. This role provides the opportunity to drive scale, ensure consistency, and reduce risk across all parts of the organization. In order to succeed in its mission, BPI places tremendous focus on developing its people, improving their leadership and delivery skills and broadening their firm and industry knowledge. Projects and roles are assigned not just based on successful delivery, but also on individual development objectives and career aspirations. BPI is seeking an Associate to become part of a team that will embrace your skills, eagerness, and passion while giving you the freedom to grow professionally. Cloud Operations + Innovation (CO+I) is the team behind one of the world’s largest cloud infrastructures, responsible for powering all Microsoft online Products and Services as well as powering Microsoft’s “Cloud First” mission. Our focus is on smart growth, high efficiency, and delivering a trusted experience to customers and partners worldwide. The Institute for Digital Molecular Analytics and Science (IDMxS) is a new, unique interdisciplinary Research Centre of Excellence (RCE), funded by Ministry of Education (Singapore), Nanyang Technological University and National University of Singapore. Hosted by NTU in partnership with NUS, IDMxS is the world’s first organized effort focused on interfacing the biological and living world with the world of information technology and data science whilst providing fundamental scientific development, grounded in materials science, optics, and interfacial chemistry. IDMxS invites applications for the position of Research Fellow tasked to prepare perovskite nanomaterials, perform photonics and electromagnetic field distribution simulations, as well as micro/nano fabrication. He/She is also required to perform data analysis and data interpretation and assist the PI in the supervision and mentoring of graduate students. Key Responsibilities: To prepare and process halide perovskite nanomaterials. To operate, optimize, troubleshoot and maintain femtosecond, ns and CW laser systems. To setup and align optical beamlines/setups for optical spectroscopy experiments. To perform photonics and electromagnetic field distribution simulations. To perform micro/nano fabrication using a range of techniques (electron beam lithography, laser direct-write, inject printing, vacuum deposition, and molecular self-assembly etc.). To fabricate perovskite devices. To perform data analysis and data interpretation of optical spectroscopy experiments independently To assist the principal investigator with the writing of progress reports, research papers and research grants. To assist the principal investigator in the supervision and mentoring of a small research team comprising of post-graduate students and undergraduate students. Job Requirements: Candidate must possess at least an PhD Degree in Physics or Chemistry or Chemical Sciences or Engineering. PhD candidates who are about to submit their thesis for examination or have submitted their thesis for defence are also welcomed to apply. In addition, candidate must possess at least a BSc 1st Class/2nd Class Upper Honours Degree in Physics or Chemistry or Chemical Sciences or Engineering. Critical Requirement: Candidate must have a Minimum 3 Years of Research Experience in micro/nanofabrication. Critical Requirement: Candidate must also have a Minimum 3 Years of Research Experience in the synthesis of halide perovskite nanomaterials. Excellent knowledge and experience in synthesis of halide perovskite nanomaterials. Excellent knowledge and experience in optics, photophysics of semiconductors, lasers, and optical spectroscopy is essential. Excellent knowledge and experience in photonic and electromagnetic distribution simulations (for example COMSOL, FDTD, Lumerical and so on). Excellent knowledge and experience in micro/nanofabrication techniques (such as electron beam lithography, laser direct-write, inject printing, vacuum deposition, and molecular self-assembly etc.) We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

As one of the world’s leading and largest graduate business schools, INSEAD brings together people, cultures and ideas to change lives and to transform organisations. A global perspective and cultural diversity are reflected in all aspects of our research and teaching. With campuses in Europe (France), Asia (Singapore), Middle East (Abu Dhabi) and North America (San Francisco), INSEAD’s business education and research spans three continents. INSEAD is currently looking for an Admissions Executive to join our Executive Education Department. This is a temporary (1 year contract) and full-time position that will be based at our Asia Campus in One-North, Singapore. Reporting to the Admissions Manager, the Admissions Executive actively engages with internal and external stakeholders to manage all the applications and admissions responsibilities to support the successful delivery of the entire portfolio of Online Open Enrolment Programmes (OEP), Face to Face / Live Virtual OEPs and customised programmes. The Admissions Executive works independently in a functional role, as well as part of a collaborative team. Key Responsibilities will include Prioritise tasks to work on various stages of the applications and admissions process. Liaise closely with the team of Programme Advisors (PA) to manage applications received from individuals and groups. Engage closely with the Online Team to finalise the class size and to expedite last minute applications and acceptance. Manage the invoicing requests as well as the Payment Online Email Box with Finance Team to ensure that applications submitted corresponds with payments made and support applicants on required documents. Monitor the various discounts schemes offered for groups/corporates and manage the various Free Seats offered to corporate clients, students etc. Collaborate with PA and Data Management Team (DMT) to manage the Prepayment Scheme (PPS). Communicate the Acceptance Emails in a prompt manner to all participants; follow up with any feedback or requests for transfers/cancellations/late payments/refunds received, in a timely manner. Update requests for transfers and cancellations for review process, as well as graduation results into Peoplesoft. Finalise and document all programme specificities in programme checklists for future references, process-refinement, benchmarking best practices, etc. Participate in internal projects aimed at streamlining processes, knowledge-sharing to improve work efficiencies and quality. Build strong working relationships within the Admissions Team, as well as across teams in Executive Education department. To be successful in this role, you should have Diploma in any discipline. At least 1 to 2 years experience in an administrative role. Prior education industry experience a plus. Excellent attention to details, process oriented and highly adaptable to change. Able to multi-task and excel in a fast-paced environment. Excellent verbal and written communications skills. IT savvy and excellent command of computer tools such as MS Office (Word, Excel) etc.

Hiring_Company: DATABRICKS ASIAPAC UNIFIED ANALYTICS PTE. LTD.
Job_Descriptions: While candidates in the listed locations are encouraged for this role, we are open to remote candidates in other locations. As a Specialist Solutions Architect (SSA), you will guide customers in building big data solutions on Databricks that span a large variety of use cases. These are customer-facing roles, working with and supporting the Solution Architects, requiring hands-on production experience with Apache Spark™ and expertise in other data technologies. SSAs help customers through design and successful implementation of essential workloads while aligning their technical roadmap for expanding the usage of the Databricks Lakehouse Platform. As a deep go-to-expert reporting to the Specialist Field Engineering Manager, you will continue to strengthen your technical skills through mentorship, learning, and internal training programs and establish yourself in an area of specialty - whether that be performance tuning, machine learning, industry expertise, or more. The impact you will have: Provide technical leadership to guide strategic customers to successful implementations on big data projects, ranging from architectural design to data engineering to model deployment Architect production level workloads, including end-to-end pipeline load performance testing and optimisation Provide technical expertise in an area such as data management, cloud platforms, data science, machine learning, or architecture Assist Solution Architects with more advanced aspects of the technical sale including custom proof of concept content, estimating workload sizing, and custom architectures Improve community adoption (through tutorials, training, hackathons, conference presentations) Contribute to the Databricks Community What we look for: You will have experience in a customer-facing technical role with expertise in at least one of the following: Software Engineer/Data Engineer: query tuning, performance tuning, troubleshooting, and debugging Spark or other big data solutions. Data Scientist/ML Engineer: model selection, model lifecycle, hyper parameter tuning, model serving, deep learning. Data Applications Engineer: Build use cases that use data - such as risk modelling, fraud detection, customer life-time value. Experience with design and implementation of big data technologies such as Spark/Delta, Hadoop, NoSQL, MPP, OLTP, and OLAP. Maintain and extend production data systems to evolve with complex needs. Production programming experience in Python, R, Scala or Java Deep Specialty Expertise in at least one of the following areas: Experience scaling big data workloads that are performant and cost-effective. Experience with Development Tools for CI/CD, Unit and Integration testing, Automation and Orchestration, REST API, BI tools and SQL Interfaces. Experience designing data solutions on cloud infrastructure and services, such as AWS, Azure, or GCP using best practises in cloud security and networking. Experience with ML concepts covering Model Tracking, Model Serving and other aspects of productionizing ML pipelines in distributed data processing environments like Apache Spark, using tools like MLflow. Degree in a quantitative discipline (Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Operations Research) This role can be remote, but we prefer that you be located in the job listing area and can travel up to 30% when needed. Benefits Private medical, dental and optical Life, accident, disability and critical illness coverage Central Provident Fund for local nationals Equity awards Paid parental leave Gym reimbursement Annual personal development fund Work headphones reimbursement Business travel accident insurance About Databricks Databricks is the data and AI company. More than 5,000 organizations worldwide — including Comcast, Condé Nast, H&M, and over 40% of the Fortune 500 — rely on the Databricks Lakehouse Platform to unify their data, analytics and AI. Databricks is headquartered in San Francisco, with offices around the globe. We provide independent assessment and validation of the effectiveness of key processes and controls across the Company. We provide a holistic assessment on the risk profile of the company and influence the measured and responsible risk management across the organization. We are a team of approximately 900 auditors globally based in the US, EMEA, APAC and Latin America. The Corporate Audit Department audit team provides audit coverage of key corporate functions including global Financial Crimes/Anti-Money Laundering (AML). We are currently seeking a talented and experienced Senior Auditor with a minimum of 3 years of Audit experience, including Financial Crimes (AML and Sanctions) audit, for our Singapore office. About Bank of America Our purpose as a firm is to make financial lives better, through the power of every connection. Across the world, we partner with leading corporate and institutional investors through our offices in more than 35 countries. In the U.S. alone, we serve almost all of the Fortune 500 companies and approximately 67 million consumer and small-business clients. We provide a full suite of financial products and services, from banking and investments to asset and risk management. We cover a broad range of asset classes, making us a global leader in corporate and investment banking, sales and trading. Connecting Asia Pacific to the world Our Asia Pacific team is spread across 19 cities in 12 markets. We are focused on connecting Asia to the world and the world to Asia, using our global expertise to ensure success is shared between us, our clients and our communities. Our regional footprint covers 12 currencies, more than a dozen languages and five time zones, placing us firmly among the region’s leading financial services companies.

About Standard Chartered We are a leading international bank focused on helping people and companies prosper across Asia, Africa and the Middle East. To us, good performance is about much more than turning a profit. It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing, better together and never settle - as well as our brand promise, Here for good. We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base. The Role Responsibilities The Financial Markets Technology function is responsible for the systems development and technology infrastructure which underpin the Bank’s services for Financial Markets clients. The “IBOR Transition” is a bank-wide programme preparing the bank for the discontinuance of LIBOR publication. SABRE (Standard Chartered Analytics Booking and Risk Engine) is the bank’s strategic platform for Financial Markets Risk and Valuations. It is entirely developed in house at SCB. It is also the central data repository for all Financial Markets transactions providing information for regulatory and non-regulatory reporting purposes. Role The successful candidate will be responsible for key Financial Markets technology delivery supporting the IBOR transition programme. As part of the project team responsible for delivering IBOR changes to the SABRE platform, the candidate will have to coordinate with the wider set of teams working on the IBOR transition initiative and ensure overall readiness for the transition to Risk Free Rates. The candidate will have a proven working knowledge of the IBOR transition industry requirements and implementation. Candidate will be able to quickly analyse and identify impacts to SCB FM’s products and systems from the transition and will then drive the design and delivery of the appropriate solutions. Key responsibilities • Analyze and understand regulatory/industry changes and user’s needs. Challenge status quo and the reflex of solutioning rather than focusing on the core requirement or perpetuating old processes and bad habits • Design and propose optimal and future proof solutions to meet these requirements • Define and articulate unambiguous implementation instructions for the development teams, success criteria for the test team and operational changes (when applicable) for end users • Be an active member of the scrum team, contributing to the solution build and delivery, reviewing test cases, closing out open issues/questions, assisting with sprint planning and retrospective • Assist the business with user acceptance tests, including communication, planning, preparation and test case preparation • Pro-actively engage, manage and build strong relationships with both business and technology stakeholders • Identify risks and impediments early, plan mitigating steps and communicate these to workstream lead and business stakeholders in a timely manner • Be delivery focused, committed to specific tasks and ensure these and the deadlines are met • Providing regular and detailed transparency on the delivery progress to the governance forums • Deliver functional consistency across the various projects by influencing architecture and design decisions Key Measurables • Stakeholder feedback (Business and Technology) • Delivery of individual tasks within the projected timelines • Quality of solutions design (future proof, generic, scalable, supportable, high degree of CI/CD) • Quality of documentation, high degree of test coverage of the solutions being delivered • Compliance with corporate governance, ensuring projects pass internal audits and reviews Our Ideal Candidate • 10+ years’ experience with business analysis and solution design in the Financial Markets industry • Proven working knowledge on the IBOR transition industry initiative • Strong knowledge of derivatives across impacted asset classes encompassing product knowledge, pricing, risk analytics and trade life cycle • Sound knowledge of the FO to BO trade flow, including Market and Credit Risk Management, Middle Office, Operations and Finance activities • Background in engineering is a big plus • Strong problem solving and analytical skills. • Quantitative finance understanding, ability to liaise with quants on pricing and risk topics • Proven ability to work across business streams and have exposure to front to back system implementation. • Knowledge and experience of Agile development practices • Ability to work proactively, independently and displays strong initiative. • Pragmatic team player with an attention to detail. • Ability to drive multiple agenda and effectively manage priorities. • Multicultural awareness. • Displays personal authority, integrity and ethics Role Specific Technical Competencies • Subject matter expertise on the IBOR transition industry change • Quantitative background on Financial Markets products (ideally on Interest Rates derivatives) • Good understanding of key technology concepts, basics in SQL, functional programming and architecture. Strong technical acumen is a big plus. Apply now to join the Bank for those with big career ambitions. To view information on our benefits including our flexible working please visit our career pages. We welcome conversations on flexible working.

About Syfe Syfe is one of the fastest growing digital investment platforms in Singapore. We provide a holistic investment solution for retail users - from passively managed wealth portfolios which are personalized and diversified using proprietary algorithms to active trading of single stock securities. Our mission is to enable sophisticated investing at a low cost. In July 2021, we closed a S$40 million Series B funding round led by Valar Ventures , just 9 months after raising Series A. Our existing investors followed on their original investment in a short time frame, which speaks volumes about our rapid growth and our future ahead. Moving forward, we will accelerate our expansion across geographies, launch new products and grow our team. The Syfe team consists of industry experts from finance, e-commerce, and technology. We come from startups as well as large corporations. Excellence in execution is in our DNA. We aim to become Asia Pacific’s largest Digital Investment Platform by leveraging technology to provide a superior investing experience for our customers. Syfe was named Best Digital Advisory Solution at DigFin Group Innovation 2021 and Top Startups to look out for in 2022 by TechCrunch. Find out more about us at www.syfe.com Press links - Bloomberg, Business Times, TechCrunch The Role Syfe is on the hunt for a Brand Strategy Lead who desires to be part of a rapidly growing organisation that prides itself on innovation and a strong culture of ownership. The Brand Strategist will set a legacy in shaping the direction and execution of the Syfe brand as we expand our presence in markets across Asia-Pacific and enlarge our product suite. This is an opportunity to work on the foundational building blocks for the brand as it grows its reputation and reaches out to larger audiences across the region. You will play an instrumental role in rewiring and reimagining how Syfe communicates to its target audience in today’s context. A key responsibility for the brand strategist is to work with data to gather, synthesize and articulate important insights which will inform how we develop and execute brand communications with precision, in support of Syfe’s commercial goals. You will be working with the creative talent in the team and our partners, to cultivate the best creative work that Syfe can deliver, in order to cut through the clutter in the marketplace. Responsibilities Develop insightful, data-backed creative briefs that inspire the best, most creative work Lead the way in transforming the way we communicate to today and in the future Build rapport with stakeholders internal and external to gather the data you need Craft our differentiation strategy and keep it relevant for the audiences of tomorrow Create and safeguard guidelines that define our company’s voice both online and offline Design brand level and promotional campaigns for new products and markets Develop and maintain our social media strategy Assess the performance of our advertising campaigns and events Analyze market trends and identify new opportunities and challenges Qualifications You have a keen understanding, and deep experience in brand communications You have worked on a wide range of brands and created market-leading campaigns and work that achieved positive results You are creative and aren’t afraid to innovate and be different You are able to simplify the most complex information, and distill it into a simple human truth You are willing to be challenged and react effectively to new information, opinions and direction You have a strong understanding of the full integrated marketing mix and is a digital native You have strong communication skills and are able to write, story tell and articulate your thoughts well You are able to work well with partners to deliver quality work Additional requirements: Creative agency experienced preferred 7 - 10 years strategy experience

Job purpose igloocompany is at a critical juncture of growth as we drive towards our vision of a world without keys. As the VP of Product, you will be a leader in the organization playing an important role in this growth journey. Your experiences have made you a strong leader with a proven track record in defining and driving product vision and strategy for a high-growth startup. You are highly motivated to solve our toughest challenges and create top-notch experiences for our clients. Importantly, you will also create an innovative, inclusive product culture that fosters engagement, growth, and collaboration as the company scales. You’ll lead a team of product leaders, product managers, designers, project managers and analysts to create a future of a keyless world. This will be done in collaboration with Engineering, Design, Marketing, and the rest of the organization. The right leader will be able to form strong relationships with other functions and influence the entire team to execute effectively. It's critical that the VP is able to establish credibility at the executive level, have a strong product viewpoint, and be able to lead the product direction of the entire company. The role directly reports to the CEO. Responsibilities Establish the product vision, drive product strategy, road-mapping and execution across the organization Think strategically and be able to communicate and articulate the product strategy effectively Collaborate with senior leadership and cross functional stakeholders to influence and execute on the product vision and roadmap Mentor, empower and recruit high performing product managers and product designers who have shipped technology products at scale Define the processes needed to achieve operational excellence in all major areas, including client-focused feature development, player experiences, viewing experiences, and scalability of systems. Build and maintain a high performing, diverse & collaborative product culture Effectively manage your team by defining clear OKRs for your department, and taking responsibility for your department’s KPI’s, budgeting and goals. Manage and evolve the development and product lifecycle process and achieve ideal delivery cadences for different product suites. Drive the company's understanding of the total addressable market, new opportunities, risks and competitive landscape, and align customer needs into clear, well-defined feature requirements Manage successful product launches to ensure internal teams are prepared to sell, support, and drive adoption of new and updated product capabilities PLEASE NOTE: Periodic international travel (between the US and our HQ in Singapore) will be required Requirements You have 10+ years of experience building and delivering user-centered, engaging experiences across a range of platforms and can demonstrate the success and impact of your efforts for both users and business. You have experience in developing and shipping products that involve both hardware and software components, and you have achieved considerable scale with those products. You possess deep knowledge of consumer/enterprise products, have a highly refined visual design sensibility, and a passion for enterprise SaaS solutions. Experiences in built environment or property technology is a plus Your experiences include 5+ years of management experience, including experience leading product teams of 20+ people within a cross functional organization in a high growth venture backed company. You have a good technical background, either across software development, firmware development, cyber security, artificial intelligence or other emerging technologies, bonus points if you have coding experience yourself. You have exceptional people skills, and are a leader who people want to follow. You build trust, inspire, and mentor your team, ensuring that your teammates are motivated, recognized and rewarded. You have a keen sense of balance between delivery speed and technology implementation. You are able to navigate the often complex and ambiguous space of the fast growing and ever changing nature of the tech industry, and build ambitious but robust and realistic plans. You are a great communicator (verbal, written, and visual) who has the ability to influence and build consensus both within a product team and with executive stakeholders across the company. BA/BS and/or MA/MS in a related field Experience in project management & transitioning to a public company is a plus What we can offer you Challenging work in a fun and collaborative environment Spacious open-concept and conveniently located office Team lunches and company events Multicultural teams represented by 15+ nationalities Comprehensive corporate insurance and dental benefit Exclusive staff discounts for company products Flexible working arrangements and casual work setting

Hiring_Company: TATA CONSULTANCY SERVICES ASIA PACIFIC PTE. LTD.
Job_Descriptions: The OCM Lead will play a key role in ensuring program (change initiatives) outcome by increasing employee adoption and usage. This role will focus on the people side of change, including changes to business processes, systems and technology, job roles and organization structures. The primary responsibility will be creating and implementing organisational change management strategies and plans that maximize employee adoption and usage and managing resistance. The OCM Lead will work to drive faster adoption, higher utilization of and proficiency with the changes that impact employees. These improvements will increase benefit realization, value creation, ROI and the achievement of results and outcomes. The position demands experience in technology enabled business transformation. This role will have to work through many others in and out of the organization to succeed and align the business towards the transformation vision and bring in alignment across the local business units. The OCM Lead will act as a coach for senior leaders and executives in helping them fulfil the role of change sponsor. The OCM Lead may also provide direct support and coaching to all levels of managers and supervisors as they help their direct reports through transitions. The OCM Lead will also support project teams in integrating change management activities into their project plans. The OCM Lead will: Apply a structured methodology and lead change management activities Apply Organisation Change Management process and tools to create Change Strategy and plan to support adoption of the changes required by a project or initiative. Align customer leadership to change vision Drive.

Job Description - Customer Service Analyst 3-Support (22000354) Applicants are required to read, write, and speak the following languages: English Hospitality Cloud Customer Success Manager Oracle Hospitality Cloud As a member of the Oracle HGBU organization, your focus is to deliver post-sales support and solutions to the Oracle customer base while serving as an advocate for customer needs. This involves resolving post-sales customer inquiries via phone and electronic means, as well as, technical questions regarding the use of and troubleshooting for our Electronic Support Services. A primary point of contact for customers, you are responsible for facilitating customer relationships with Support and providing advice and assistance to internal Oracle employees on diverse customer situations and escalated issues. The Cloud Customer Success Manager serves as the single point of contact for Oracle Hospitality Cloud customers. Cloud Customer Success Managers duties include: •   Develop and maintain operational relationships with selected Enterprise Cloud customers up to and including Executive Level. •   Through daily activities, strive for a high degree of customer satisfaction resulting in a positive references for the services that the Customer is consuming from Oracle. •   Represent their customers as a single point of contact within Oracle Cloud Operations and partner with Support Customer Advocacy Managers along with Oracle Leadership to bind them together in a working team. •   Monitor and proactively manage cloud deliverables and service obligations to insure the proper quality of service is consistently provided to our customers. •   Handle day-to-day Customer relationship and when necessary for crises or escalations, connect the appropriate parties to reach resolution. •   Educate the customer on the most effective and efficient way to use Oracle processes, products, tools, systems, interfaces and procedures. •   Drive internal processes to ensure the highest quality of service, and work with teams to improve as needed. Maintain accurate account information. •   Perform with a high level of autonomy, reporting to management regularly on customer status and striving to keep cloud escalations at a minimum while keeping leadership appraised of any possible flare points. •   Contribute to the On-boarding, training and mentoring of new Cloud Customer Success Managers. •   Excels individually while contributing to the team dynamic by providing direction and mentorship of others in addition to sharing any relevant product information or issues with the team. •   Based upon interaction with customer teams, make recommendations to relevant Account Managers for possible up-sell activities to include services, add-ons, etc. •   Develop, manage, and present period service improvement plans internally and with customers. •   Proactively communicate to assigned customers following service interruption events. •   Recognise chronic or reoccurring trends in service interruptions and elevate them to Senior Management. •   Creation of weekly/monthly system and infrastructure performance reports. SKILLS & EXPERIENCE Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Hospitality or related field preferred. 2+ years’ experience with customer engagement relating to IT Service Delivery or IT Project Management, with a proven record of driving process improvement and increasing customer satisfaction Strategic Thinking – ability to create a vision and deliver to clients. Teamwork – candidates will need to be strong team players, who support their colleagues and share their skills. Good interpersonal, work flow management and communications skills. Experience in similar roles within IT or Hospitality environment, preferably both. Excellent analytical troubleshooting skills and ability to own problems through to resolution as well as being able to analyse statistical data Track record of working within diverse and successful IT teams. Ability to demonstrate a mature understanding of key Business groups Excellent documentation and PowerPoint presentation skills (i.e. able to efficiently create a multi-page deck to deliver a key message Good project and time management skills - Ability to work independently and manage one’s time.􀀀 Verbal and written communication skills, problem solving skills, attention to detail and interpersonal skills. Knowledge of business and management principles involved in strategic planning, resource allocation and production methods. Influencing – the ability to influence technology decisions and represent accordingly Duties and tasks are varied and complex; independent judgment needed. Fully competent in own area of expertise. May have project lead role and or supervise lower level personnel. BS degree or equivalent experience relevant to functional area. Description Audio and video are everywhere, from traditional delivery platforms such as television to the smartphone in your pocket. To meet the growing demands of audio-visual production to support Bank of Singapore’s digital roadmap and strategy, we are looking for a dynamic, creative and forward-thinking Videographers for Multimedia (Associate/Senior Associate) to join the Creative Marketing team. As part of the COO Office and likened to an advertising agency but in-house within the Bank, the Creative Marketing is Bank of Singapore’s brand guardian and supports the Bank in the development of key client communications and corporate/product marketing collaterals (including videos and application software i.e. apps) to promote products and services targeted at private wealth management individuals. Responsibilities: Produce fresh and dynamic videos and audio materials that translates the Bank’s image, products and services into compelling works for visually sophisticated audiences.
