Good communications skills, able to work under deadline pressure and manage time efficiently. Highly capable in filming and editing audios and videos, with a good knowledge of video and audio production equipment. Possess the technical acumen to operate, configure, set up, and fix audio, video, lighting, or other film production equipment properly without guidance. Demonstrated skill and highly competent with Adobe Creative Suite i.e. Premiere Pro, AfterEffects, Illustrator and Photoshop, and Final Cut Pro. Experience with live streaming and working in an agency environment is a plus. Capable of working independently and managing varying needs with a collaborative mindset.

Job_Title: APAC Senior Director of Quality Assurance
Job_Descriptions: Find what drives you on a team with a more than 70-year history of discovery, determination, and innovation. As a global leader in high-tech filtration, separation, and purification, Pall Corporation thrives on helping our customers protect people. Our products serve a wide range of markets, so if your interests lie along the spectrum of Life Sciences to Industrial, you’ll find a rewarding role here. For the exponentially curious, Pall is a place you can thrive and amplify your impact on the world. Pall is proud to work alongside a community of nine fellow Danaher Life Sciences companies. Together, we’re pioneering the future of science and medicine, developing products that enable researchers in the fight to save lives. Responsibilities: Drive a quality centric culture throughout all functional groups. Develop positive relationships with Key Customers, OPS team and Commercial Leaders Develop and implement Micro Electronics Industry leading quality systems and processes to support customer needs and expectations Establish and handle QA tracking and trending of crucial performance measures (DPPM) and the preparation of periodic reports for management review. Chair the BU Management Review meetings Implementation of effective QMS in line with Corporate, BU and local requirements Continuous improvement of Core Value Drivers in support of quality and business growth. About Standard Chartered We are a leading international bank focused on helping people and companies prosper across Asia, Africa and the Middle East. To us, good performance is about much more than turning a profit. It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing, better together and never settle - as well as our brand promise, Here for good. We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base. The Role Responsibilities The Trade Risk Unit (TRU) sits within the Trade Product organisation and is responsible for conceptualising, leading, and driving various risk initiatives within Trade. The purpose of this role is to lead and drive relevant risk initiatives to manage the overall risk profile within Trade as the First Line of Defence (1LOD). This role includes working with Trade Product, COO, Trade Operations, Product Development, Technology, FCSO and other teams as required to deliver on the requirements of the role. Responsibilities and Deliverables • Provide leadership and oversight to ensure the successful delivery of Trade risk initiatives in alignment with the Trade strategy - ‘Future of Trade’ • Support Executive Director, TRU and Head, TRU in the design, development, and implementation of risk initiatives across fraud risk, financial crime risk, operational risk, and regulatory risk projects. • Drive the completion of root cause reviews, identification of elevated residual risks seek alignment on actions required for such risks to be addressed • Define and deliver on the risk initiative implementation roadmap and change programme to drive the implementation • Manage the overall delivery risk for the various risk initiatives by working closely with stakeholders across Trade Product, COO, Trade Operations, Product Development, Technology, FCSO • Manage implementation of relevant Policies and Standards applicable to Trade by executing business impact assessments (BIAs), dispensation sign offs within timelines • Manage the coordination of prioritisation into applicable Prioritisation forums (at Trade level) including applicable budget needs • Design and implement monitoring and management information reporting requirements. • Develop inputs from stakeholders on emerging risk issues and work out ways and means for design and execution of appropriate new/amended controls Governance • Manage execution and completion of action plans around elevated residual risks, treatment plans, audit, and assurance reviews • Write and present papers for various risk committees, regulatory submissions • Prepare and cascade lessons learned from audit findings, assurance activities and specific investigations as appropriate. • Track significant issues and themes arising from root cause reviews, events and incidences, and regulatory inspections • Define metrics and / or key risk indicators (KRI) including those relevant to AML, Sanctions, and Fraud. Present findings from data at relevant risk committees and forums • Analyze and interpret data to produce reports that help the bank identify and manage emerging areas of risk / vulnerability and thus drive remediation action within Trade Key Stakeholders • Trade Product teams – Group and region / country • Trade COO • All process owners in Trade • Risk Product Owners (POs) • CCIB COO • NFRC members • 2LOD Risk Framework owners for CFCC, Fraud, Credit, Operational, ICS and Technology risk • FCSO teams • Trade Product Development • Trade Technology • GIA teams • GBS teams • TB Risk and Conduct • Operational Resilience teams Regulatory & Business Conduct • Display exemplary conduct and live by the Group’s Values and Code of Conduct. • Take personal responsibility for embedding the highest standards of ethics, including regulatory and business conduct, across Standard Chartered Bank. This includes understanding and ensuring compliance with, in letter and spirit, all applicable laws, regulations, guidelines and the Group Code of Conduct. • Effectively and collaboratively identify, escalate, mitigate, and resolve risk, conduct and compliance matters. Job_Title: Head of Market Steering and Performance Management
Job_Descriptions: The Head of Market Steering and Performance Management is responsible for local sales steering and business development/partnership management with the aim to optimize the revenue development of the Lufthansa Group carriers, Joint Venture partners and Eurowings Discover in the assigned markets. He/She is responsible for the local adaption and implementation of the global sales strategy and initiates action plans in the local markets. He/She represents the assigned markets towards Global Performance Management, Steering & BI as well as commercial interfaces within VR. He/She takes an active role in the definition/representation of market requirements in direct exchange with Global Performance Management, Steering & BI, Commercial Offer, Channel Management as well as Network & Mobility Management and the evaluation and implementation of local existing and new partnerships. He/She leads a team of Performance Management Experts and Market Offer Coordinators and is disciplinary responsible for all Non-Execute Sales functions at the GM location. Tasks · Development and Implementation of an optimal local sales strategy to improve the market position of LHG Hub Airlines. Coordination of the LH Group and JV strategy in the markets · Process optimization and development of new concepts with regard to revenue quality and increase for the assigned markets · Steering of the local revenue budget for LHG and JV partners by regular analysis of market, competition and LH Group & JV performance to identify action fields, threats & opportunities. Creation of sales roadmaps for local markets. · Representation of interests towards central departments/committees incl. active participation in decisions, e.g. for “Performance Management and Analysis Session”, “Sales Steering Campus Sessions”, AX Directs round, VR RPM, CCB etc. · Ensuring the competitive product positioning of the Lufthansa Group across all markets including definition, evaluation and prioritization of market and customer requirements towards Offer and Channel Management, also based on constant consolidation/delivery of market intelligence findings and trends towards Global Performance Management, Steering & BI, Commercial Offer Management and Channel Management · Definition, evaluation and prioritization of market and customer requirements for the flight plan and evaluation of existing regional partnerships · Active development and strengthening of the cooperation with JV partners in the assigned markets. Participation in projects to increase the harmonization of processes within the regional JV environment · Steering the efficient and effective further development of internal processes and the sales organization · Coordinating and steering the interface to Channel Management with regard to Global OTAs and LHG.com in order to ensure a holistic commercial approach in assigned markets · Select, lead, guide and motivate his/her team *All other duties as assigned or required Position / Qualification requirements • Candidate must possess at least Bachelor’s degree in Business or equivalent • Minimum 5 years’ work experience in Sales or other commercial processes (Network Management, Revenue Management, Distribution and Alliances) • Experience in Aviation Industry is an advantage • Excellent command of English language both written and spoken • Knowledge of German language and other languages desirable • Excellent knowledge of MS-Office applications • Self-motivated individual that can work independently • Experience working in an international environment is an advantage • Strong analytical skills and business sense • Problem solving / solution oriented • Productivity driven • Strong team player • Leadership skills • Cooperation skills/ Team player • Structured / systematic approach/ Process orientation • Well groomed appearance If you have what it takes and would like to work with an exciting and progressive company, please place your application complete with detailed resume including your current and expected salary. Note: Only short listed applicants will be notified.

Position Summary The International Move Consultant acts as the primary point of coordination providing service delivery to our clients and their assignees whilst maintaining the highest level of customer service. The International Move Consultant will be the first point of contact for the moving aspects of an employee’s relocation. They will support and organize the movement of household goods and personal items for our client’s assignees. They will be responsible for guiding the employee through the process ensuring that you provide an excellent level of customer service. The International Move Consultant will have strong organisation skills, problem-solving abilities, cultural awareness and time management abilities. Functions And Responsibilities 60% Communicate Proactively, Build Relationships & Ensure Customer Quality Customer Set move expectations and proactively anticipate the customer's needs. Handle customer inquiries with a sense of urgency and empathy. Phone and e-mail transferee and/or accounts wherever they might be globally, involves occasionally working outside of standard business hours. Summer is our busy season, and customers sometimes need us outside of regular working hours. Manage and monitor customer expectations, requests and issues timely and effectively. Maintain minimum quality service score as defined by our IMC Scorecard. Full accountability for the success of each assigned move. Supply Chain Coordinate and communicate the logistics, pricing, move details and troubleshoot/resolve any process glitches. Phone and e-mail agent contact with overseas household goods moving agents. Phone and e-mail contact with our supply chain in the US/Canada/Overseas (steamship lines, port brokers, truckers). Account Support Communicate and report back to national accounts/bookers as required Identify areas for enhancement or improvement; work with management to systematically resolve. Internal Support Coordinate with various departments such as accounts payable, accounts receivable, billing, claims network management and account management to ensure proper completion of all aspects of a move. 10% Logistics Department Follow pre-defined move management process and our proprietary workflow system tasks as defined by the book of business and shipment workflow. Anticipate, plan and ensure the most efficient and cost-effective shipment routing based on customer requirements. Select and coordinate with the best household goods movers at origin and destination, truckers and freight lines (ocean/air/road) to best forward the shipment according to account requirements. Partner with customs and other governmental agencies as required. Mitigate adverse financial impact of problematic situations through use of technical knowledge, established business contacts and persistence. 10% Move Administration Data integrity: Document within the Globalcom/PROMOVE/Navision systems all customer, agent and move information including revenue, expense and correspondence/action taken. Paperwork and file management: responsible for all shipping documentation and timely forwarding to destination agent, port agent, inland carrier etc. while minimizing paper files by utilizing system notes and scanning capabilities. Enable billing: Ensure all updated revenue information is complete and all relevant paperwork to support accurate and timely billing is delivered while partnering with billing staff. About us Portofino is a blockchain based digital asset startup located in the Crypto Valley. Our headquarters are in Zug, Switzerland with offices in London, Singapore and New York. Backed by the biggest VCs in the world, we aim to build the best digital asset “platform” in order to become the world’s leading crypto-currency market maker. Our first mission is to build & deploy a high frequency trading system in digital asset markets. We are looking for experienced and junior C++ performance developers to join us at the earliest possible. Summary of the role As a performance or quantitative developer, you form the backbone of the business and are responsible for building our trading system as well as connecting to new exchanges. As an experienced C++ developer you are passionate about building scalable & performant technology. You are an ideal candidate if you are: Interested in solving low-latency systems problems and optimising performance-critical code Passionate about technology, interested in both low level details of how computer hardware operates and high-level design of large systems Have a “start up” mentality, are able to iterate quickly and write production quality code rapidly Your responsibilities Responsibilities will span the entirety of the trading system, and will cover multiple products & assets within the crypto-currency trading universe (e.g. cash, futures) Projects may include connecting to new exchanges, upgrading major trading system components, designing a completely new application from scratch In this role, you will have the opportunity to deploy your coding skills to build a large-scale trading system (from scratch!) and understand crypto-currency trading Your profile Higher university degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering with excellent grades Exposure to capital markets or interest in crypto and blockchain environments is highly preferred Required technical competencies (must have) 2+ years experience coding in C++ (C++11 onwards); professional experience in back end engineering/ python programming Experience with writing high performance code & benchmarking Advanced skills with object oriented design, data structures and algorithms Experience with GDB & Valgrind Familiar with all phases of SDLC (unit testing, automatic build and release, peer-review, Jenkins, Jira, GNU Make / Cmake) Expert troubleshooting abilities with strong debugging and problem solving skills Understanding of network and hardware architecture Experience with thread pinning, CPU isolation, kernel bypass and shared memory Preferred technical competencies Experience developing distributed systems and cloud services Database applications, intermediate (SQL, KDB) Experience with running code in containerized environments is a plus, especially Docker and Kubernetes Experience with AWS (or other cloud software/infra) (nice to have) Experience with intel TBB, CAF of disruptor Experience with userspace network stack Experience with multiplexed event loops like boost asio, libuv Experience with custom memory allocation, memory pooling, handling of statically allocated buffers and buffer sets, using buffer sequences and scatter-gather io Experience with replacement classes for standard library classes Experience with NUMA, cache optimising code, hardware inference Experience in stopping template bloat Your personality You are a team player with good interpersonal and communication skills. You can work in a very focussed manner when required and pay extreme attention to details. You are a quick learner, have a flexible mentality and if required, are not afraid of stepping out of your comfort zone. You are passionate about technology, are a person who takes initiative, likes to challenge yourself and is willing to go the extra mile to achieve individual as well as team goals. You can work in a team as well as by yourself and can work under pressure to meet deadlines. You speak fluent English and enjoy working in an international environment. Our offer We can offer you excellent career opportunities with complete project responsibility right from the beginning You will be part of an international team and will have the opportunity to learn from as well as work together with industry experts We offer a flat hierarchy where every employee has equal chance to present their ideas and be part of a scaling business at a very exciting stage of the company We work hard and celebrate every success. We celebrate often You grow as we grow Interested? Then apply directly or contact us at **********@portofino.tech We look forward to your application!

This position reports to the Yield Manager and will be involved in the Yield Engineering of specific product lines. Investigate root causes of yield loss in a volume semiconductor-manufacturing environment. Responsibilities include finding, reporting, tracking, and driving corrective actions of Yield issues. The candidate will be responsible for tracking and evaluating parametric and defect-related yield loss for BAW product lines. The interns must deploy yield enhancement strategies to characterize and react to yield issues and baseline shifts quickly, performing first-level commonality analysis and initiating involvement process and Equipment Engineers to resolve. Assist engineering in short-term problem solving and long-term continuous improvement for yield improvement and cost-saving projects. Daily monitor product yield and highlight low yield issues if have, analyze sort yield data, inline metrology data, and defect data Achieve targeted product yield to reduce overall product cost and to fulfill downstream production line output and end. Develop new methods and tools used for yield enhancement independent from existing practices Involve in productivity improvement project through process optimization through the use of quality improvements tools Assist engineering in short-term problem solving and long-term continuous improvement for yield improvement and cost-saving projects. Requirements: Diploma in Electronic Engineering, Computer Science or equivalent qualifications Ability to understand Quality & Yield performance by product, process & equipment. Understand the whole process of the production line from setup to the final test Able to analyze the abnormality and scrap with analysis tool & database Cross function interaction and continuous improvement across various departments

This position reports to the Yield Manager and will be involved in the Yield Engineering of specific product lines. Understand the whole process of the production line from setup to the final test Able to analyze the abnormality and scrap with analysis tool & database Cross function interaction and continuous improvement across various departments
